PRESENTATION_GENERAL.question: Does the entity disclose the change in the revaluation surplus arising from a change in the decommissioning, restoration and similar liability in other comprehensive income as a separate line item

If the entity settles a dividend payable by distributing non-cash assets, does it present any difference between the carrying amount of the assets distributed and the carrying amount of the dividend payable as a separate line item in profit or loss?

If the entity settles a dividend payable by distributing non-cash assets, does the entity present any difference between the carrying amount of the assets distributed and the carrying amount of the dividend payable as a separate line item in profit or loss
Does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?
Does the entity present a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?
Does the entity present a statement of changes in equity for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?
Does the entity present notes, comprising material accounting policy information and other explanatory information as part of a complete set of financial statements?
Does the entity present comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IAS 1.38 and 38A as part of a complete set of financial statements?
Does the entity prominently display whether the financial statements cover the individual entity or a group of entities at least once in the financial statements?
Does the entity prominently display the level of rounding used in the presentation of amounts in the financial statements at least once in the financial statements?

When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose that it complies with applicable IFRS accounting standards, except that it departs from a requirement of an IFRS to achieve a fair presentation?

When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?

If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be so misleading in the circumstances that it would conflict with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?

If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the financial impact of the departure on each item in the financial statements that would have been reported in complying with the requirement?

When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose for each period presented, the adjustments to each item in the financial statements that management concluded would be necessary to achieve a fair presentation?

If the end of the entity's reporting period changes and the annual financial statements are presented for a period longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose: a. The reporting period covered by the financial statements?
If the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements is amended and comparative amounts are reclassified, does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification?

If the presentation or classification of items in the financial statements is amended and comparative amounts are reclassified, does the entity disclose the reason for the reclassification?

When an entity voluntarily presents comparative information in addition to the minimum comparative financial statements required by IFRSs, does the entity present related note information for those additional statements?
In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?
In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?
In the circumstances described in IAS 1.40A, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?

Does the entity retain the classification of items in the financial statements from one period to the next?

Does the entity present, outside the financial statements, a financial review by management that describes the entity's sources of funding and its targeted ratio of liability to equity?

Does the entity present, outside the financial statements, a financial review by management that describes the entity's resources not recognised in the statement of financial position in accordance with IFRS accounting standards?

Does the entity present each material class of similar items separately in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present separately items of a dissimilar nature or function unless they are immaterial?
Unless required or permitted by another IFRS accounting standard, does the entity present separately, and not offset, assets and liabilities?
If the entity does not present separately current and non-current assets in its statement of financial position, does it present all assets in order of liquidity?
If the entity does not present separately current and non-current liabilities in its statement of financial position, does it present all liabilities in order of liquidity?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is expected to be realised in, or is intended for sale or consumption in, the entity's normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is held primarily for trading?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify cash or a cash equivalent asset as current unless it is restricted from being exchanged or used to settle a liability for at least 12 months after the reporting period?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it expects to settle the liability in its normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it holds the liability primarily for the purpose of trading?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if the liability is due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify financial liabilities as current if they are due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period, even if the original term was for a period longer than 12 months?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify financial liabilities as current if they are due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period, even if an agreement to refinance, or to reschedule payments, on a long-term basis is completed after the reporting period and before the financial statements are authorised for issue?

Does the entity include issued capital and reserves attributable to owners of the parent as a line item in its statement of financial position?

The amount that best represents its maximum exposure to credit risk at the end of the reporting period, separately for insurance contracts issued and reinsurance contracts held b. Information about the credit quality of reinsurance contracts held that are assets
Does the entity present a statement (or statements) of financial performance for the reporting period?

Does the entity disclose that it has complied with applicable IFRSs, except where it departed to achieve a fair presentation?
Does the entity disclose, for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each item in the financial statements?

If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose, for each period, the adjustments that would be necessary for a fair presentation?
Does the entity provide comparative information for the preceding period for all amounts reported in the current statements, except when IFRS permits or requires otherwise?
Does the entity include comparative narrative and descriptive information if necessary to understand the current period's financial statements?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the nature of the reclassification (including at the beginning of the preceding period)?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified?
If presentation or classification changes, does the entity disclose the reason for the reclassification?
If reclassification of comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts?
Does the entity present the current and preceding period in each primary financial statement and in the notes?
When voluntarily presenting additional comparatives, does the entity present related note information for those additional statements?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the current period?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the end of the preceding period?
In the circumstances of IFRS 18.37, does the entity present a statement of financial position as at the beginning of the preceding period?
When presenting a third statement of financial position, is its date the beginning of the preceding period regardless of earlier comparative information?
Does the entity retain the presentation of items from one period to the next?
Does the entity retain the classification of items from one period to the next?

Does the entity aggregate or disaggregate items to present line items in the primary financial statements that fulfil their role of providing useful structured summaries, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?
To faithfully represent an item, does the entity provide all descriptions and explanations necessary for users to understand that item?
Does the entity separately report assets and liabilities, and income and expenses, unless offsetting is required or permitted by an IFRS accounting standard?
Does the entity include all items of income and expense in a reporting period in the statement of profit or loss, unless an IFRS accounting standard requires or permits otherwise?
Does the entity disclose the amount and classification of items of income and expense before and after the date of the change in the outcome of the assessment in the current period?

Does the entity classify income and expenses related to investments in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries in the investing category?
Does the entity classify income and expenses related to cash and cash equivalents in the investing category?
Does the entity classify income and expenses related to other assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources in the investing category?

If the entity invests in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries and accounts for them using the equity method, does it classify related income and expenses in the investing category?

If the entity invests in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries and does not account for them using the equity method, does it classify related income and expenses in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers and does not meet the criteria in IFRS 18.56(a), does it classify related income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents that relate to providing financing to customers in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers and does not meet the criteria in IFRS 18.56(a), does it classify related income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents that do not relate to providing financing to customers based on an accounting policy choice between operating or investing category?

If the entity invests in other assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources, does it classify related income and expenses on those assets in the operating category?

Does the entity classify incremental expenses directly attributable to the issue and extinguishment of liabilities arising from transactions that involve only the raising of finance in the financing category?

Does the entity classify interest income and expenses from liabilities arising from transactions that do not involve only the raising of finance in the financing category if identified for IFRS purposes?

Does the entity classify income and expenses arising from changes in interest rates on liabilities arising from transactions that do not involve only the raising of finance in the financing category if identified for IFRS purposes?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a hedging instrument designated under IFRS 9 in the same category as the income and expenses affected by the risks managed?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a hedging instrument designated under IFRS 9 in the operating category if required to avoid grossing up?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on an undesignated component of a designated hedging instrument in the same category as the designated component?
Does the entity classify ineffective portions of a gain or loss in the same category as the effective portions?
Does the entity exclude from the financing category and classify in the operating category income and expenses from issued investment contracts with participation features recognised under IFRS 9?
Does the entity exclude from the financing category and classify in the operating category insurance finance income and expenses recognised under IFRS 17?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions involving only the raising of finance in the operating category when those liabilities relate to providing financing?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions involving only the raising of finance based on an accounting policy choice when those liabilities do not relate to providing financing?
If the entity cannot distinguish between liabilities related and not related to providing financing to customers, does it classify all related income and expenses in the operating category?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions not involving only the raising of finance in the financing category when specified in IFRS 18.61?

If the entity provides financing to customers, does it classify income and expenses from liabilities that arise from transactions not involving only the raising of finance in the operating category when not specified in IFRS 18.61?
Does the entity classify income and expenses from discontinued operations in the discontinued operations category as required by IFRS 5?
If applying classification requirements in IFRS 18.B65 and B67 would involve undue cost or effort, does the entity classify the affected foreign exchange differences in the operating category?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for operating profit or loss in the statement of profit or loss?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for profit or loss in the statement of profit or loss?
Are additional line items and subtotals compatible with the structure required by IFRS 18.22?
Are additional line items and subtotals consistent from period to period, in accordance with IFRS 18.30?
Are additional line items and subtotals displayed no more prominently than the totals and subtotals required by IFRS?
Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for profit or loss?
Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for other comprehensive income (see IFRS 18.B86–B87)?
Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income a total for comprehensive income, being the total of profit or loss and other comprehensive income?
Does the entity present an allocation of comprehensive income for the reporting period attributable to non-controlling interests?
Does the entity present an allocation of comprehensive income for the reporting period attributable to owners of the parent?
Does the entity classify income and expenses included in the statement presenting comprehensive income as those that will be reclassified to profit or loss when specific conditions are met?
Does the entity classify income and expenses included in the statement presenting comprehensive income as those that will not be reclassified to profit or loss?

Does the entity present, in each category of the statement presenting comprehensive income, a line item for the share of other comprehensive income of associates and joint ventures accounted for using the equity method?
Does the entity present, in each category of the statement presenting comprehensive income, a line item for other items of other comprehensive income?

Does the entity present in the statement presenting comprehensive income or disclose in the notes reclassification adjustments relating to components of other comprehensive income (see IFRS 18.B88–B89)?

If the entity discloses reclassification adjustments in the notes, does it present in the statement presenting comprehensive income the items of other comprehensive income after any related reclassification adjustments?
If the entity does not present separately current and non-current assets in its statement of financial position, does it present all assets in order of liquidity?
If the entity does not present separately current and non-current liabilities in its statement of financial position, does it present all liabilities in order of liquidity?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is expected to be realised in, or is intended for sale or consumption in, the entity's normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is held primarily for trading?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is expected to be realised within 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current assets, does it classify an asset as current when it is cash or a cash equivalent, unless restricted from use to settle a liability for at least 12 months?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it expects to settle it in its normal operating cycle?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it holds it primarily for trading?
If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it is due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify a liability as current if it does not have the right to defer settlement of the liability for at least 12 months after the reporting period?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify its financial liabilities as current if they are due to be settled within 12 months after the reporting period, even if the original term was longer?

If the entity separately presents current and non-current liabilities, does it classify its financial liabilities as current if an agreement to refinance or reschedule payments on a long-term basis is completed after the reporting period but before authorization of the financial statements?

If the entity breaches a covenant on a long-term loan arrangement on or before the end of the reporting period, causing the liability to become payable on demand, does it classify that liability as current even if the lender agreed after period-end not to demand payment?

If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose facts and circumstances indicating possible difficulty in complying with the covenants?
Does the entity present property, plant and equipment as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present goodwill as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present IFRS 17 contract assets, disaggregated per IFRS 17.78, as a separate line item?
Does the entity present investments accounted for using the equity method as a separate line item?

Does the entity present cash and cash equivalents as a separate line item?

Does the entity present trade and other payables as a separate line item?

Does the entity present liabilities in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?

Does the entity present issued capital and reserves attributable to owners of the parent in the statement of financial position?

Does the entity include liabilities in disposal groups under IFRS 5 as a separate line item?

Does the statement of changes in equity include total comprehensive income for the reporting period, showing separately the total amounts attributable to owners of the parent and to non-controlling interests?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from profit or loss?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from other comprehensive income?

Does the statement of changes in equity include, for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period showing changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners, showing separately contributions by and distributions to owners and changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in a loss of control?
Does the entity present, either in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes, the amount of dividends recognised as distributions to owners during the reporting period?
Does the entity present, either in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes, the related amount of dividends per share?
Does the entity present notes to the financial statements in a systematic manner, as far as practicable?

For the comparative period immediately preceding the first application of IFRS 18, does the entity disclose a reconciliation for each line item in the statement of profit or loss showing the amounts previously presented applying IAS 1?

Has the entity disclosed the line item(s) in the statement of comprehensive income where acquisition-related costs are recognised?

Does the entity separately classify and disclose adjustments in the current period to previously presented discontinued operations amounts that relate directly to disposals in prior periods?
If a component ceases to be classified as held for sale, does the entity reclassify its results out of discontinued operations into continuing operations for all periods presented?
Does the entity present information that enables users to evaluate the financial effects of disposals of non-current assets or disposal groups held for sale?

Does the entity disclose the gain or loss recognised under IFRS 5.20–22 and, if not separately presented, the caption in the statement of comprehensive income where it is included?

Does the entity treat exploration and evaluation assets as a separate class of assets and make the disclosures required by either IAS 16 or IAS 38 consistently with how the assets are classified?
Does the entity present the disclosures required by IFRS 7.42B-42H in a single note in its financial statements

Does the entity separately disclose the net amounts presented in the statement of financial position?

Does the entity separately disclose the net amount after deducting the master netting arrangement amounts from the net amounts presented in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity report those non-current assets located in all foreign countries in total?
Does the entity report those non-current assets located in an individual foreign country if material?
Does the entity present the disclosures required by IFRS 7.42B–42H in a single note in its financial statements?
Does the entity present any unconditional rights to consideration separately from contract assets as a receivable?

Does it classify income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents in the investing category?
Does it classify income and expenses from other assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of the entity’s other resources in the investing category?

If the entity as a main business activity invests in associates, joint ventures and unconsolidated subsidiaries, does it classify related income and expenses in the investing category when those assets are equity-accounted?
Does it classify related income and expenses in the operating category when those assets are not equity-accounted?

If the entity as a main business activity provides financing to customers and does not meet the criteria in IFRS 18.56(a), does it classify in the operating category income and expenses from cash and cash equivalents related to providing financing?

If the entity cannot distinguish between financing-related and non-financing-related cash and cash equivalents, does it classify all related income and expenses in the operating category?

Has the entity presented a single statement of profit and loss with profit or loss and other comprehensive income in two sections, with the profit or loss section presented first, followed directly by the other comprehensive income section?
Has the entity presented all of the financial statements in a complete set with equal prominence?

When presenting a financial review by management outside the financial statements, has the entity included a review of the main factors influencing financial performance (including environmental changes, entity's response, and investment/dividend policy), sources of funding and targeted liabilities-to-equity ratio, and resources not recognized in the balance sheet?

In extremely rare circumstances where compliance with an Ind AS requirement would be misleading and departure is permitted, has the entity disclosed that management concluded the financial statements present a true and fair view, complied with applicable Ind ASs except for the stated departure, provided the title of the departed Ind AS, nature of departure, required treatment, reasons for misleading nature, and the adopted treatment, and for each period presented, the financial effect of the departure on each financial statement item?

If the entity departed from a requirement of an Ind AS in a prior period and that departure affects current period financial statements, have the disclosures required by paragraph 1.20(c) and 1.20(d) been provided?

In extremely rare circumstances where compliance with an Ind AS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, has the entity, to the maximum extent possible, reduced misleading aspects by disclosing the title of the Ind AS, nature of the requirement, reasons why compliance is misleading, and for each period presented, the adjustments necessary to present a true and fair view?

Has the entity separately presented each material class of similar items, and separately presented items of a dissimilar nature or function unless they are immaterial or required by law to be aggregated?

When changing the reporting period end resulting in financial statements longer or shorter than one year, has the entity disclosed the reason for the period change and the fact that amounts presented in the Financial Statements are not entirely comparable?

Has the entity presented comparative information in respect of the preceding period for all amounts reported in the current period’s Financial Statements, and included comparative narrative and descriptive information if it is relevant to understanding the current period’s Financial Statements?
Does the narrative information provided in the financial statements for the preceding period(s) continue to be relevant in the current period?

If presenting comparative information in addition to the minimum comparative Financial Statements required by Ind ASs, has the entity prepared it in accordance with Ind ASs, consisting of one or more statements referred to in paragraph 10 (not necessarily a complete set), and presented related note information for those additional statements?

Has the entity presented a third balance sheet as at the beginning of the preceding period, in addition to the minimum comparative financial statements required in paragraph 38A, when it applies an accounting policy retrospectively, makes a retrospective restatement of items in its financial statements, or reclassifies items in its financial statements, and such action has a material effect on the information in the balance sheet at the beginning of the preceding period?

In the circumstances described in paragraph 40A, has the entity presented three balance sheets as at the end of the current period, the end of the preceding period, and the beginning of the preceding period?

Is the date of the opening balance sheet as at the beginning of the preceding period, regardless of whether the entity’s financial statements present comparative information for earlier periods or not?

Has the entity retained the presentation and classification of items in the financial statements from one period to the next unless: it is apparent, following a significant change in the nature of the entity’s operations or a review of its financial statements, that another presentation or classification would be more appropriate having regard to the criteria for the selection and application of accounting policies in Ind AS 8 Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors; or an Ind AS requires a change in presentation?

Has the entity presented additional line items (including by disaggregating the line items listed in paragraph 1.54), headings and subtotals in the Balance Sheet when such presentation is relevant to an understanding of the entity’s financial position?

When an entity presents subtotals in accordance with paragraph 1.55, are those subtotals comprised of line items made up of amounts recognised and measured in accordance with Ind AS; presented and labelled in a manner that makes the constituent line items clear and understandable; consistent from period to period (in accordance with paragraph 45); and not displayed with more prominence than the subtotals and totals required in Ind AS for the balance sheet?

Has the entity presented current and non-current assets, and current and non-current liabilities, as separate classifications in its Balance Sheet, or, as an exception, presented all assets and liabilities in order of liquidity if that presentation provides information that is more reliable and relevant?

Whichever method of presentation is adopted, has the entity disclosed the amount expected to be recovered or settled after more than twelve months for each asset and liability line item that combines amounts expected to be recovered or settled: no more than twelve months after the reporting period; and more than twelve months after the reporting period?
Has the entity disclosed, either in the Balance Sheet or in the notes, further sub-classifications of the line items presented, classified in a manner appropriate to the entity’s operations?

Does the statement of profit and loss present, in addition to the profit or loss and Other Comprehensive Income sections: profit or loss; total Other Comprehensive Income; and comprehensive income for the period (being the total of profit or loss and Other Comprehensive Income)?

Has the entity presented the following items, in addition to the profit or loss and Other Comprehensive Income sections, as allocation of profit or loss and Other Comprehensive Income for the period: profit or loss for the period attributable to non-controlling interests and owners of the parent; and comprehensive income for the period attributable to non-controlling interests and owners of the parent?

Does the Other Comprehensive Income section present line items for the amounts for the period of: items of Other Comprehensive Income (excluding amounts related to equity-method associates/joint ventures), classified by nature and grouped into those that, in accordance with other Ind ASs: will not be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss; and will be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss when specific conditions are met; and the share of the Other Comprehensive Income of associates and joint ventures accounted for using the equity method, separated into the share of items that, in accordance with other Ind ASs: will not be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss; and will be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss when specific conditions are met?

Has the entity presented additional line items (including by disaggregating the line items listed in paragraph 1.82), headings and subtotals in the statement of profit and loss, when such presentation is relevant to an understanding of the entity’s financial performance?

When an entity presents subtotals in accordance with paragraph 1.85, are those subtotals: comprised of line items made up of amounts recognised and measured in accordance with Ind AS; presented and labelled in a manner that makes the line items that constitute the subtotal clear and understandable; consistent from period to period (in accordance with paragraph 1.45); and not displayed with more prominence than the subtotals and totals required in Ind AS for the statement of profit and loss?

Has the entity presented the line items in the statement of profit and loss that reconcile any subtotals presented in accordance with paragraph 1.85 with the subtotals or totals required in Ind AS for such statement?
Has the entity avoided presenting any items of income or expense as 'extraordinary items' in the statement of profit and loss or in the notes?

Has the entity presented reclassification adjustments in the statement of profit and loss or in the notes, and if presenting in the notes, has it presented the items of other comprehensive income after any related reclassification adjustments?
Has the entity presented the analysis of expenses recognized in profit or loss using a classification based on the nature of expense method in the statement of profit and loss?

Does the Statement of Changes in Equity include: total comprehensive income for the period (showing separately amounts attributable to owners of the parent and to non-controlling interests); for each component of equity, the effects of retrospective application or retrospective restatement recognized in accordance with Ind AS 8; and for each component of equity, a reconciliation between the carrying amount at the beginning and the end of the period, separately disclosing changes resulting from: profit or loss; Other Comprehensive Income; transactions with owners in their capacity as owners (showing separately contributions by and distributions to owners and changes in ownership interests in subsidiaries that do not result in a loss of control); and any item recognized directly in equity (such as capital reserve)?

Has the following information been presented in the Statement of Changes in Equity or in the notes: for each component of equity an analysis of Other Comprehensive Income by item; the amount of dividends recognized as distributions to owners during the period; and the related amount of dividends per share?
Has the entity presented notes providing information about the basis of preparation of the financial statements and specific accounting policies as a separate section of the financial statements?

Whether dividends declared after the reporting period but before the financial statements are approved for issue are disclosed in the notes in accordance with Ind AS 1, Presentation of Financial Statements, as no obligation exists at that time?

PRESENTATION_GENERAL.question: Whether the entity has presented the difference described in paragraph 10.A14 as a separate line item in profit or loss?
Has the entity prepared and presented an **opening Ind AS Balance Sheet** at the date of transition to Ind ASs?
In case financial statements for previous periods are not presented, has the entity **disclosed that fact** in first Ind AS financial statements?

In case deemed cost is used in the opening Ind AS Balance Sheet for an investment in a subsidiary, joint venture or associate in its separate financial statements in accordance with paragraph 101.D15, has the first Ind AS separate financial statements **disclosed**: a) the aggregate deemed cost of those investments for which deemed cost is their previous GAAP carrying amount; b) the aggregate deemed cost of those investments for which deemed cost is fair value; and c) the aggregate adjustment to the carrying amounts reported under previous GAAP?

To comply with paragraph 23, if the entity presents an interim financial report in accordance with Ind AS 34 for part of the period covered by its first Ind AS Financial Statements, has the entity satisfied the following requirements in addition to Ind AS 34 requirements: a) each such interim financial report includes reconciliations of equity and total comprehensive income, if applicable; b) the first interim financial report includes the reconciliations or a cross-reference; and c) if accounting policies or exemptions change, has it explained the changes and updated reconciliations?

Whether an entity has re-presented the disclosures in paragraph 105.33 for prior periods presented in the financial statements so that the disclosures relate to all operations that have been discontinued by the end of the reporting period for the latest period presented.

Whether the entity has made separate classification in discontinued operations adjustments in the current period to amounts previously presented in discontinued operations that are directly related to the disposal of a discontinued operation in a prior period and disclosed the nature and amount of such adjustments.

If an entity ceases to classify a component of an entity as held for sale, whether the results of operations of the component previously presented in discontinued operations in accordance with paragraphs 105.33–105.35 are reclassified and included in income from continuing operations for all periods presented, and whether the amounts for prior periods are described as having been re-presented.

For non-current asset or disposal group classified as held for sale, whether the entity has disclosed: (a) non-current asset and the assets of a disposal group classified as held for sale separately from other assets in the balance sheet; (b) liabilities of a disposal group classified as held for sale separately from other liabilities in the balance sheet; (c) assets and liabilities not offset and presented as a single amount; (d) the major classes of assets and liabilities classified as held for sale either in the balance sheet or in the notes, except as permitted by paragraph 105.39; and (e) cumulative income or expense recognised in other comprehensive income relating to a non-current asset (or disposal group) classified as held for sale.

In case either paragraph 105.26 or paragraph 105.29 applies, whether the entity has disclosed, in the period of the decision to change the plan to sell the non-current asset (or disposal group): (i) a description of the facts; (ii) circumstances leading to the decision; and (iii) the effect of the decision on the results of operations for the period and any prior periods presented.

Whether the entity has treated exploration and evaluation of assets as a separate class of assets and makes the disclosures required by either Ind AS 16 or Ind AS 38 consistent with how the assets are classified?

In case investments in equity instruments are designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, as permitted by paragraph 109.5.7.5, whether the entity has made disclosure of: (a) **which investments in equity instruments have been designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income**; (b) **the reasons for using this presentation alternative**; (c) **the fair value of each such investment at the end of the reporting period**; (d) **dividends recognised during the period**, showing separately those related to investments derecognised during the reporting period and those related to investments held at the end of the reporting period; (e) **any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the period** including the reason for such transfers?

To ensure that all the relevant disclosures have been presented in a single note or separate section in its financial statements, or if not, has the entity **adequately cross-referenced the information located elsewhere from the financial statements to some other statement**, such as a management commentary or risk report, that is available to users of the financial statements on the same terms as the financial statements and at the same time?

An entity need not duplicate information that is already presented elsewhere, provided that the information is **incorporated by cross reference from the financial statements to other statements**, such as a management commentary or risk report that is available to users of the financial statements on the same terms as the financial statements and at the same time? Without the information incorporated by cross-reference, the financial statements are incomplete.

For equity instruments designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, has the entity disclosed which investments are so designated, reasons for this presentation, fair value at period end, dividends recognized (separately for derecognized and held investments), and any transfers of cumulative gain or loss within equity?
If credit risk information is presented elsewhere, is it incorporated by cross-reference to ensure completeness of financial statements?

Has the entity presented a schedule showing the effects on equity attributable to owners of the parent for any changes in ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in loss of control [112.18]?

Does the information required by paragraph 112.24(b) include the entity's exposure to risk from past involvement with unconsolidated structured entities, even if there is no current contractual involvement at the reporting date [112.25]?

Has the entity disclosed (preferably in tabular format) the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities related to its interests in unconsolidated structured entities, the balance sheet line items where they are recognized, the amount representing its maximum exposure to loss (and how determined, or reasons if not quantifiable), and a comparison of carrying amounts to maximum loss exposure [112.29]?
Has the entity presented information separately for interests in subsidiaries, joint ventures, joint operations, associates, and unconsolidated structured entities [112.B4]?
Whether the presentation of the quantitative disclosures required by Ind AS 113 are given in a tabular format unless other format is more appropriate.

Whether the entity has presented separate line items in the Balance Sheet for: a) the total of all regulatory deferral account debit balances; b) the total of all regulatory deferral account credit balances.

Whether the entity has presented in the Other Comprehensive Income section of the statement of profit and loss, the net movement in all regulatory deferral account balances for the reporting period that relate to items recognized in Other Comprehensive Income. b) Whether separate line items have been used for the net movement related to items that, in accordance with other Standards: (i) will not be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss; and (ii) will be reclassified subsequently to profit or loss when specific conditions are met.

Whether the entity has presented a separate line item in the profit or loss section of the statement of profit and loss, for the remaining net movement in all regulatory deferral account balances for the reporting period, excluding movements that are not reflected in profit or loss, such as amounts acquired. b) Whether this separate line item has distinguished from the income and expenses that are presented in accordance with other Standards by the use of a sub-total, which is drawn before the net movement in regulatory deferral account balances.

When the entity presents a discontinued operation or a disposal group in accordance with Ind AS 105 Non-current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, whether the entity has presented: a) any related regulatory deferral account balances; b) the net movement in those balances, as applicable; c) with the regulatory deferral account balances and movements in those balances, instead of within the disposal groups or discontinued operations.

When either party to a contract has performed, whether the entity presented the contract in the balance sheet as a contract asset or a contract liability, depending on the relationship between the entity’s performance and the customer’s payment [1]? Whether the entity presented any unconditional rights to consideration separately as a receivable [1]?

Whether the entity provided both of the following additional disclosures for the reporting periods that include the date of initial application, if this standard is applied retrospectively in accordance with paragraph C3(b): (a) the amount by which each financial statement line item is affected in the current reporting period by the application of this Standard as compared to Ind AS 11 and Ind AS 18 [11]; and (b) an explanation of the reasons for significant changes identified in C8(a) [12]?

If not separately disclosed in the statement of profit and loss, has the entity disclosed the amount of compensation from third parties for PPE items that were impaired, lost, or given up and included in profit or loss?

Paragraph 19.120 requires an entity to recognise service cost and net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset) in profit or loss. This Standard does not specify how an entity should present service cost and net interest on the net defined benefit liability (asset). Whether the entity presented those components in accordance with Ind AS 1?
Are grants related to income presented as part of profit or loss, either separately or under a general heading such as 'Other income', or alternatively, deducted in reporting the related expense?
Has the entity disclosed the accounting policy adopted for government grants, including the methods of presentation adopted in the financial statements?

Have the disclosures required under paragraph 24.18 been **separately made for all categories of related parties**, including: The parent, Entities with joint control or significant influence over the entity, Subsidiaries, Associates, Joint ventures in which the entity is a joint venturer, Key management personnel of the entity or its parent, and Other related parties?

If the parent entity has elected not to prepare consolidated financial statements (in accordance with Ind AS 110.4(a)) and instead prepares separate financial statements, has it disclosed: the fact that the financial statements are separate financial statements, that the exemption from consolidation was used, the name and principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different) of the entity whose consolidated financial statements complying with Ind ASs have been produced for public use, and the address where those consolidated financial statements are obtainable?

If the parent entity has elected not to prepare consolidated financial statements, has it provided a list of significant investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures, and associates, including their name, principal place of business (and country of incorporation if different), and the proportion of ownership interest (and voting rights, if different) held?
If an investment entity that is a parent prepares separate financial statements as its only financial statements (in accordance with Ind AS 27.8A), has it disclosed that fact?

If an investment entity that is a parent prepares separate financial statements as its only financial statements, has it provided disclosures relating to investment entities as required by Ind AS 112, 'Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities'?

If a parent entity (other than those covered by Ind AS 27.16-27.16A) or an investor with joint control of, or significant influence over, an investee prepares separate financial statements, has it identified the financial statements prepared in accordance with Ind AS 110, Ind AS 111, or Ind AS 28 to which they relate?

If a parent entity (other than those covered by Ind AS 27.16-27.16A) or an investor with joint control of, or significant influence over, an investee prepares separate financial statements, has it disclosed that the statements are separate financial statements?

If a parent entity (other than those covered by Ind AS 27.16-27.16A) or an investor with joint control of, or significant influence over, an investee prepares separate financial statements, has it provided a list of significant investments in subsidiaries, joint ventures, and associates, including their name, principal place of business (and country of incorporation if different), and the proportion of ownership interest (and voting rights, if different) held?

If a parent entity (other than those covered by Ind AS 27.16-27.16A) or an investor with joint control of, or significant influence over, an investee prepares separate financial statements, has it described the method used to account for the listed investments?
Whether the entity has given separate disclosure of gain or loss on the net monetary position included in profit or loss?
Whether the entity has disclosed whether the financial statements are based on a historical cost approach or a current cost approach?
Whether the amount of transaction costs accounted for as a deduction from equity in the period is disclosed separately in accordance with Ind AS 1, Presentation of Financial Statements?

PRESENTATION_GENERAL.question: Has the entity provided additional disclosures required by Ind AS 105, Non-current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations, when a restructuring meets the definition of a discontinued operation [1]?
Whether the entity has disclosed the policy adopted to determine the composition of cash and cash equivalents in order to comply with Ind AS 1 Presentation of Financial Statements?

DISCLOSURE_GENERAL.question: Does the entity disclose a description of each service concession arrangement (or, in aggregate, each class of arrangements)?
Does the entity disclose its obligations to acquire or build items of property, plant and equipment under each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose its obligations to deliver, or its rights to receive, specified assets at the end of the concession period?
Does the entity disclose renewal and termination options embedded in each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose any other rights and obligations arising from each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose any changes in each arrangement that occurred during the reporting period?
In a distribution of non-cash assets to owners, does the entity disclose the carrying amount of the dividend payable at the beginning and end of the reporting period?

If the entity declares a dividend to distribute a non-cash asset after the end of a reporting period but before the financial statements are authorised for issue, does it disclose the nature of the asset to be distributed?
Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of the asset to be distributed as of the end of the reporting period?

If the fair value of the asset to be distributed is disclosed, does the entity provide the quantitative disclosures required by IFRS 13 in a tabular format (unless another format is more appropriate)?
If there has been a change in valuation technique, does the entity disclose that change and the reason(s) for it?

If a change in the redemption prohibition of members’ shares leads to a transfer between financial liabilities and equity, does the entity disclose separately the amount, timing and reason for the transfer
Does the entity (as a contributor) disclose the nature of its interest in a fund and any restrictions on access to the assets in the fund

Does the entity disclose its accounting policy for liabilities arising from participating in specific market-waste electrical and electronic equipment
Are the financial statements identified clearly (using an unambiguous title) and distinguished from other information in the same published document?

Does the entity prominently display the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered by the financial statements or notes at least once in the financial statements?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the domicile of the entity?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the legal form of the entity?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the entity's country of incorporation?

If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the nature of the entity's operations and its principal activities?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the name of the parent?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose the name of the ultimate parent of the group?
If not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements, does the entity disclose information regarding the length of its life (if the entity is a limited life entity)?

Does the entity provide additional disclosures if the requirements in IFRSs are insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of particular transactions, other events, and conditions on the entity's financial position and financial performance?
Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRSs?

When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?

When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be so misleading in the circumstances that it would conflict with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?
When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which the entity has departed?
If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?
If the entity departed from an IFRS requirement in a prior period affecting current period amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question?
When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the nature of the requirement?

When compliance with an IFRS requirement would be misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the reason why management concluded that complying with that requirement is so misleading in the circumstances that it conflicts with the objective of financial statements set out in the Conceptual Framework?
If the entity cannot reclassify comparative amounts after making every reasonable effort to do so, does the entity disclose the reason for not reclassifying the amounts?

If the entity cannot reclassify comparative amounts after making every reasonable effort to do so, does the entity disclose the nature of the adjustments that would have been made if the amounts were reclassified?
When an entity is required to present an additional statement of financial position in accordance with IAS 1.40A, does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 1.41–44 and IAS 8?

Does the entity disclose the amount expected to be recovered or settled after more than 12 months for each asset and liability line item that combines amounts expected to be recovered or settled within twelve months and amounts expected to be recovered or settled more than 12 months after the reporting period?

Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of changes in equity, or in the notes, the related amount of dividends per share?

Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of changes in equity to any related information in the notes?

Does the entity disclose key assumptions about the future, and other sources of key estimation uncertainty at the end of the reporting period, that have a significant risk of causing a material adjustment to the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities within the next financial year?
For the assets and liabilities in IAS 1.125 above, does the entity disclose their nature?
For the assets and liabilities in IAS 1.125 above, does the entity disclose their carrying amount as at the end of the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate the entity's objectives, policies and processes for managing capital?

Are the financial statements identified clearly and distinguished from other information in the same published document?
Does the entity provide comparative information in respect of the preceding period as specified in IFRS 18.31–32?
Does the entity clearly identify each primary financial statement and the notes?
Does the entity disclose prominently the name of the reporting entity or other means of identification, and any change in that information from the end of the preceding reporting period?
Does the entity disclose prominently whether the financial statements are of an individual entity or a group of entities?
Does the entity disclose prominently the date of the end of the reporting period or the period covered by the financial statements?
Does the entity disclose prominently the level of rounding used for the amounts in the financial statements?

If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the domicile and legal form of the entity, its country of incorporation and the address of its registered office (or principal place of business)?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes a description of the nature of the entity's operations and its principal activities?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes the name of the parent and the ultimate parent of the group?
If not disclosed elsewhere, does the entity disclose in the notes information regarding the length of life if it is a limited-life entity?

Does the entity provide additional disclosures when compliance with IFRS is insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of transactions, events, and conditions on its financial position and performance?
Does the entity disclose an explicit and unreserved statement of compliance with IFRS Accounting Standards?
Does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it has departed?
Does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
Does the entity disclose the treatment that the IFRS would require?
Does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?
Does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS from which it departed?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the nature of the departure?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment the IFRS would require?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the reason why that treatment would be misleading?
If a prior-period departure affects current amounts, does the entity disclose the treatment adopted?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the title of the IFRS in question?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the nature of the requirement?
If compliance is misleading but departure is prohibited, does the entity disclose the reason why complying is misleading?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reporting period covered by the financial statements?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose the reason for using a longer or shorter period?
If the reporting period changes and is longer or shorter than one year, does the entity disclose that amounts are not entirely comparable?
If reclassification comparatives is impracticable, does the entity disclose the nature of the adjustments that would have been made?
When presenting a third statement of financial position, does the entity disclose the information required by IFRS 18.33–36 and IAS 8?
Does the entity retain the disclosure of items from one period to the next?
Does the entity disclose the date when the financial statements were authorised for issue?
Does the entity disclose who authorised the financial statements?
Does the entity disclose that owners or others have the power to amend the financial statements after issue, if applicable?

Does the entity provide information for financial review by management, which is separate from the financial statements, that describes and explains the main features of its financial performance and financial position and the principal uncertainties it faces

Does the entity aggregate or disaggregate items to disclose information in the notes that fulfils their role of providing material information, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?
Does the entity ensure that its aggregation and disaggregation do not obscure material information, unless doing so would override specific IFRS requirements?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity label and describe items presented in the primary financial statements or in the notes in a way that faithfully represents the characteristics of each item?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
If the entity invests in assets as a main business activity, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the entity provides financing to customers as a main business activity, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the outcome of the assessment has changed, does the entity disclose that fact and the date of the change?
Does the entity disclose the amount and classification in the prior period for items whose classification changed because of the changed outcome of the assessment?
If the entity does not disclose the information specified in (c) above because it is impracticable, does it disclose that fact?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?

Does the entity disclose the amount expected to be recovered or settled after more than 12 months for each asset and liability line item that combines amounts expected to be recovered or settled within 12 months and amounts expected to be recovered or settled after 12 months?
If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose information about the covenants (nature and timing) in the notes?
If the entity classifies loan liabilities as non-current subject to covenant compliance within 12 months, does it disclose the carrying amount of those liabilities in the notes?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
For each component of equity, does the entity either present in the statement of changes in equity or disclose in the notes an analysis of other comprehensive income by item?
Does the entity disaggregate items under IFRS 18.41 whenever the resulting information is material?
If, applying IFRS 18.41(c), the entity does not present material information in the primary financial statements, does it disclose that information in the notes?
Does the entity disclose the amount of transaction costs accounted for as a deduction from equity in the reporting period, in the statement of changes in equity or in the notes?
Do the notes disclose the basis of preparation of the financial statements?
Do the notes disclose the specific accounting policies used?
Do the notes disclose information required by IFRS accounting standards that is not presented in the primary financial statements?
Do the notes disclose information not presented in the primary financial statements but necessary for an understanding of any of them?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of financial performance to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of financial position to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of changes in equity to any related information in the notes?

If amounts disclosed in the notes are included in one or more line items in the primary financial statements, does the entity disclose in the note the line item(s) in which those amounts are included?
Does the entity disclose information that enables users to evaluate the entity's objectives, policies and processes for managing capital?
Does the entity disclose qualitative information about its objectives, policies and processes for managing capital, including a description of what it manages as capital?
Does the entity disclose the nature of externally imposed capital requirements and how those requirements are incorporated into its management of capital?
Does the entity disclose how it is meeting its objectives for managing capital?
Does the entity disclose summary quantitative data about what it manages as capital?
Does the entity disclose any changes in its objectives, policies, processes or summary quantitative data from the preceding reporting period?
Does the entity disclose whether, during the reporting period, it complied with any externally imposed capital requirements to which it is subject?
If the entity did not comply with externally imposed capital requirements, does it disclose the consequences of such non-compliance?

Does the entity disclose all management-defined performance measures in a single note, including a statement that they provide management's view of financial performance and are not necessarily comparable with similarly labeled measures of other entities?

If the calculation of a management-defined performance measure differs from policies required or permitted by IFRS, does the entity disclose that fact and, if necessary, explain the meaning of terms it uses?

Does the entity explain the meaning of terms it uses in its descriptions that are necessary to understand the aspect of financial performance being communicated (e.g., how it defines 'non-recurring expenses')?

Does the entity disclose a description of the aspect of financial performance that, in management's view, is communicated by each management-defined performance measure, including why it provides useful information?
Does the entity disclose a reconciliation between each management-defined performance measure and the most directly comparable IFRS subtotal or total?
Does the entity provide restated comparative information to reflect the change, addition, or cessation, unless it is impracticable to do so?
If the entity does not disclose the required restated comparative information because it is impracticable, does it disclose that fact?
If an entity applies IFRS 18, issued April 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2027, does it disclose that fact?

For the comparative period immediately preceding the first application of IFRS 18, does the entity disclose a reconciliation for each line item in the statement of profit or loss showing the amounts restated applying IFRS 18?
Has the entity disclosed the weighted average share price used as an input to the option pricing model for share options granted during the period?
Has the entity disclosed the exercise price used as an input to the option pricing model for share options granted during the period?
Has the entity disclosed how the fair value of goods or services received during the period was determined?
Has the entity disclosed additional information necessary to satisfy the presentation and disclosure principles in IFRS 2.44, IFRS 2.46, and IFRS 2.50?
Has the entity described the factors that make up the goodwill recognised (e.g., expected synergies, unrecognised intangibles or other factors)?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date fair value of the total consideration transferred?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date fair value of cash transferred?
Has the entity disclosed the fair value of acquired receivables at the acquisition date?
Has the entity disclosed the gross contractual amounts receivable acquired?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date amounts recognised for each major class of assets acquired?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date amounts recognised for each major class of liabilities assumed?
Has the entity described each transaction recognised separately under IFRS 3.51?
Has the entity disclosed how the acquirer accounted for each separately recognised transaction?
For transactions that settle a pre-existing relationship, has the entity disclosed the method used to determine the settlement amount?
Has the entity disclosed the total amount of acquisition-related costs?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of acquisition-related costs recognised as an expense?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of issue costs not recognised as an expense?
Has the entity explained the treatment of issue costs not recognised as an expense?
In a bargain purchase, has the entity disclosed the amount of any gain recognised?
In a bargain purchase, has the entity disclosed the line item in which the gain is recognised?
In a bargain purchase, has the entity explained why the transaction resulted in a gain?
In a staged acquisition, has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date fair value of equity interests held immediately before the final acquisition?
In a staged acquisition, has the entity disclosed any gain or loss from remeasuring the prior interest to fair value and the line item where it is recognised?
Has the entity disclosed the acquiree’s profit or loss in the consolidated statement of comprehensive income since acquisition?
Has the entity disclosed combined-entity profit or loss as if all combinations occurred at the start of the period?
If acquisition accounting is incomplete at authorization date, has the entity disclosed which disclosures could not be made?
If acquisition accounting is incomplete at authorization date, has the entity explained why those disclosures could not be made?
Has the entity disclosed the reasons why initial acquisition accounting is incomplete for particular items?
For post-acquisition periods, has the entity disclosed changes in the range of undiscounted outcomes and the reasons for those changes?
Has the entity disclosed additional goodwill recognised during the period (excluding amounts in disposal groups held for sale)?
Has the entity disclosed goodwill included in disposal groups held for sale and goodwill derecognised during the period?
Has the entity disclosed any other changes in the carrying amount of goodwill during the period?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of any gain or loss relating to identifiable assets acquired or liabilities assumed?
Has the entity explained any gain or loss of such size or nature that disclosure is relevant to understanding the combined entity’s financial statements?
Has the entity disclosed its accounting policies for insurance contracts and related assets, liabilities, income and expense?
Has the entity disclosed the recognised assets, liabilities, income and expense arising from insurance contracts?
If the entity is a cedant, has it disclosed gains and losses recognised on buying reinsurance?
Has the entity disclosed information about the nature and extent of risks arising from insurance contracts?
Has the entity disclosed information about risk management objectives and policies for mitigating risks arising from insurance contracts?
Has the entity disclosed information to identify and explain the amounts in its financial statements arising from insurance contracts?
Does the entity disclose the income from continuing operations and from discontinued operations attributable to owners of the parent?
If a subsidiary meeting discontinued-operation criteria is subject to a sale plan, does the entity disclose the IFRS 5.33–36 information for that subsidiary?
Does the entity disclose the major classes of assets and liabilities held for sale, except for newly acquired subsidiaries meeting held-for-sale on acquisition criteria?
Does the entity disclose cumulative income or expense recognised in other comprehensive income relating to assets or disposal groups held for sale?
Does the entity disclose the facts and circumstances of the sale or expected disposal and its timing and manner?
If the entity reverses held-for-sale classification, does it disclose the facts and circumstances leading to that decision?
Does the entity disclose the effect of that decision on the period’s and prior periods’ results?
If held-for-sale criteria are met after period end but before authorisation, does the entity disclose in notes the information specified in IFRS 5.41(a), (b) and (d)?
Does the entity disclose its accounting policies for exploration and evaluation expenditures, including the recognition of exploration and evaluation assets?
Does the entity disclose the amount of assets arising from the exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources?
Does the entity disclose the amount of liabilities arising from the exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources?
Does the entity disclose the amount of income arising from the exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources?
Does the entity disclose the amount of expense arising from the exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources?

If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that fact

If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 7 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that fact
Does the entity disclose any additional information that it considers necessary to meet the disclosure objectives of IFRS 7.42B above

For loans payable recognised at the end of the reporting period, does the entity disclose details of any defaults during the period of principal, interest, sinking fund, or redemption terms of those loans payable?
For loans payable recognised at the end of the reporting period, does the entity disclose the carrying amount of the loans payable in default at the end of the reporting period?

For loans payable recognised at the end of the reporting period, does the entity disclose whether the default was remedied, or the terms of the loans payable were renegotiated, before the financial statements were authorised for issue?

If, during the reporting period, there are breaches of loan agreement terms other than those described in IFRS 7.18, does the entity disclose the same information as required by IFRS 7.18 if those breaches permit the lender to demand accelerated repayment (unless the breaches were remedied, or the terms of the loan were renegotiated, on or before the end of the reporting period)

Does the entity disclose either in the statement of comprehensive income or in the notes, the fee income and expense (other than amounts included in determining the effective interest rate) arising from trust and other fiduciary activities that result in the holding or investing of assets on behalf of individuals, trusts, retirement benefit plans and other institutions?
To meet the requirement in IFRS 7.23A, does the entity provide a breakdown that discloses a profile of the timing of the nominal amount of the hedging instrument?
To meet the requirement in IFRS 7.23A, does the entity provide a breakdown that discloses, if applicable, the average price or rate (e.g., strike or forward prices, etc.) of the hedging instrument?
