When the volume of hedging relationships to which the exemption in IFRS 7.23C applies is unrepresentative of normal volumes during the period (i.e., the volume at the reporting date does not reflect the volumes during the period) does the entity disclose that fact and the reason it believes the volumes are unrepresentative
Does the entity disclose the information required in IFRS 7.24E separately by risk category. This disaggregation by risk may be provided in the notes to the financial statements

If the quantitative data disclosed as at the end of the reporting period are unrepresentative of the entity’s exposure to risk during the period, does the entity provide further information that is representative

If the disclosures provided in accordance with IFRS 7.35F-35N are insufficient to meet the objectives in IFRS 7.35B, does the entity disclose additional information that is necessary to meet those objectives
Does the entity disclose how forward-looking information has been incorporated into the determination of expected credit losses, including the use of macroeconomic information?
Does the entity disclose changes in the estimation techniques or significant assumptions made during the reporting period and the reasons for those changes?

For assets obtained by taking possession of collateral or calling on credit enhancements that meet recognition criteria, does the entity disclose the nature and carrying amount of these assets at the reporting date?

For assets obtained by taking possession of collateral or calling on credit enhancements that are not readily convertible to cash, does the entity disclose its policies for disposing of such assets or using them in operations?
Does the entity explain how summary quantitative data about its exposure to liquidity risk are determined?

If cash outflows could occur significantly earlier or be for significantly different amounts than indicated in the liquidity risk data, does the entity disclose this fact and provide quantitative information to evaluate the extent of this risk (unless included in the contractual maturity analysis)?

Unless complying with IFRS 7.41, does the entity disclose a sensitivity analysis for each type of market risk, showing how profit or loss and equity would have been affected by reasonably possible changes in risk variables at the reporting period end?
Unless complying with IFRS 7.41, does the entity disclose the methods and assumptions used in preparing the market risk sensitivity analysis?

Unless complying with IFRS 7.41, does the entity disclose changes from the previous period in the methods and assumptions used for the market risk sensitivity analysis and the reasons for such changes?

If using an alternative sensitivity analysis (e.g., value-at-risk) that reflects interdependencies between risk variables, does the entity explain the method used and the main parameters and assumptions underlying the data?

If using an alternative sensitivity analysis, does the entity explain the objective of the method used and any limitations that may result in the information not fully reflecting the fair value of the assets and liabilities involved?
Does the entity cross-refer the information of IFRS 7.13B-13E above if it is disclosed in more than one note to the financial statements
Does the entity disclose general information as described in IFRS 8.22 for each period for which a statement of comprehensive income is presented?
Does the entity separately identify and describe all material reconciling items?
If necessary information is unavailable and cost to develop it is excessive, does the entity disclose that fact?

If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 in Annual Improvements to IFRS Accounting Standards – Volume 11, issued July 2024, in its financial statements for a period beginning before 1 January 2026, does it disclose that fact
When the entity continues to recognise all transferred assets, does it disclose the carrying amounts of the transferred assets and the associated liabilities?

When the entity continues to recognise assets to the extent of its continuing involvement, does it disclose the total carrying amount of the original assets, the carrying amount it continues to recognise, and the carrying amount of associated liabilities?

For each type of continuing involvement, does the entity disclose the gain or loss recognised at the date of transfer of the assets, including whether it arose because the fair values of the components differed from the fair value of the asset as a whole?
Does the entity disclose the terms and conditions relating to those pledges?
Does the entity disclose net gains or losses on equity instruments designated at fair value through other comprehensive income?
Does the entity in that reconciliation differentiate between amounts associated with the time value of options hedging transaction-related items and time-period related items?
Does the entity disclose the significant interest rate benchmarks to which its hedging relationships exposed to benchmark-reform exceptions are exposed?
Does the entity disclose the extent of the risk exposure it manages that is directly affected by interest rate benchmark reform?
Does the entity disclose how it is managing the process to transition to alternative benchmark rates?
Does the entity disclose the nominal amount of the hedging instruments in hedging relationships subject to the benchmark-reform exceptions?
Does the entity disclose its definition of default and the reasons for selecting that definition?
Does the entity disclose how forward-looking information, including macroeconomic data, has been incorporated into the determination of expected credit losses?
Does the entity disclose any changes in estimation techniques or significant assumptions made during the reporting period and the reasons for those changes?
For those same instruments, does the entity disclose a description of collateral held and other credit enhancements and their financial effect in mitigating credit risk?
If an insurer first applies IFRS 9 in the current period, has it completed Questions 372–381 of the February 2019 Disclosure Checklist for IFRS 9 transition disclosures?
If an entity applies IFRS 17 paragraphs C28B–C28D, does it disclose the extent to which the classification overlay has been applied?
When applying that paragraph, does the entity disclose why it reached different conclusions under IFRS 9.4.1.2(a) or 9.4.1.2A(a) compared to previous assessments?

If the financial statements comply with Ind AS, has the entity provided an explicit and unreserved statement of such compliance in the notes, and has the entity avoided describing financial statements as complying with Ind AS if they do not meet all requirements?

Has the entity provided additional disclosures when compliance with the specific requirements in Ind ASs is insufficient to enable users to understand the impact of particular transactions, other events and conditions on the entity’s financial position and financial performance?

When the entity reclassifies comparative amounts, has it disclosed (including as at the beginning of the preceding period): the nature of the reclassification; the amount of each item or class of items that is reclassified; and the reason for the reclassification?

When it is impracticable to reclassify comparative amounts, has the entity disclosed: the reason for not reclassifying the amounts, and the nature of the adjustments that would have been made if the amounts had been reclassified?
Has the entity clearly identified the financial statements and distinguished them from other information in the same published document?

Has the entity disclosed the following, either in the Balance Sheet or the Statement of Changes in Equity, or in the notes: for each class of share capital (the number of shares authorised; the number of shares issued and fully paid, and issued but not fully paid; par value per share, or that the shares have no par value; a reconciliation of the number of shares outstanding at the beginning and at the end of the period; the rights, preferences and restrictions attaching to that class including restrictions on the distribution of dividends and the repayment of capital; shares in the entity held by the entity or by its subsidiaries or associates; and shares reserved for issue under options and contracts for the sale of shares, including terms and amounts); and a description of the nature and purpose of each reserve within equity?

For an entity whose capital is not limited by shares (e.g., a company limited by guarantee), has it disclosed information equivalent to that required by paragraph 1.79(a), showing changes during the period in each category of equity interest, and the rights, preferences and restrictions attaching to each category of equity interest?
Has the entity disclosed the reclassification adjustments relating to components of Other Comprehensive Income?
When items of income or expense are material, has the entity disclosed their nature and amount separately?

Do the notes present information about the basis of preparation of the Financial Statements and the specific accounting policies used; disclose the information required by Ind ASs that is not presented elsewhere in the Financial Statements; and provide information that is not presented elsewhere in the Financial Statements, but is relevant to an understanding of any of them?
Has the entity provided disclosure of material accounting policy information (referencing paragraphs 117A -117E for guidance)?

Has the entity disclosed, along with its material accounting policy information or other notes, the judgements (apart from those involving estimations as per paragraph 1.125) made by management in the process of applying the entity’s accounting policies that have the most significant effect on the amounts recognised in the financial statements?

Has the entity disclosed information about the assumptions made about the future, and other major sources of estimation uncertainty at the end of the reporting period, that have a significant risk of resulting in a material adjustment to the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities within the next financial year, including in the notes, details of their nature and their carrying amount as at the end of the reporting period?

When it is impracticable to disclose the extent of the possible effects of an assumption or another source of estimation uncertainty at the end of the reporting period, has the entity disclosed that it is reasonably possible, on the basis of existing knowledge, that outcomes within the next financial year that are different from the assumption could require a material adjustment to the carrying amount of the asset or liability affected, and in all cases, has the entity disclosed the nature and carrying amount of the specific asset or liability (or class of assets or liabilities) affected by the assumption?

Has the entity disclosed information to enable users of its financial statements to evaluate the entity’s objectives, policies and processes for managing capital, including: qualitative information (description of what it manages as capital, nature of externally imposed capital requirements and how incorporated, and how objectives are met); summary quantitative data about what it manages as capital; any changes from the previous period; whether it complied with any externally imposed capital requirements; and when not complied, the consequences of such non-compliance?

Has the entity disclosed information separately for each capital requirement to which it is subject, when an aggregate disclosure would not provide useful information or distorts a financial statement user’s understanding of an entity’s capital resources?

Has the entity made the following disclosure in the notes: the amount of dividends proposed or declared before the financial statements were approved for issue but not recognised as a distribution to owners during the period, and the related amount per share; and the amount of any cumulative preference dividends not recognised?

Has the entity provided disclosure of the following, if not disclosed elsewhere in information published with the financial statements: the domicile and legal form of the entity, its country of incorporation and the address of its registered office (or principal place of business, if different); a description of the nature of the entity’s operations and its principal activities; the name of the parent and the ultimate parent of the group; and if it is a limited life entity, information regarding the length of its life?

Whether the entity has disclosed the date when the financial statements were approved for issue and who gave that approval, and if the entity’s owners or others have the power to amend the financial statements after issue, whether such fact has been disclosed?
Whether disclosures relating to conditions that existed at the end of the reporting period, for which information was received after the reporting period, are updated in the light of new information?

Whether, for each material category of non-adjusting events after the reporting period, the nature of the event and an estimate of its financial effect (or a statement that such an estimate cannot be made) have been disclosed?

In any financial statements containing historical summaries or comparative information in accordance with previous GAAP, has the entity **labelled the previous GAAP information prominently** as not being prepared in accordance with Ind ASs and **disclosed the nature of the main adjustments** that would make it comply with Ind ASs?

When the entity becomes aware of errors made under previous GAAP, do the reconciliations required by paragraph 101.24(a) and (b) **distinguish the correction of those errors from changes in accounting policies**?

If during the period covered by its first Ind AS financial statements an entity changes its accounting policies or its use of the exemptions contained in this Ind AS, has it **explained the changes** between its first Ind AS interim financial report and its first Ind AS financial statements and **updated the reconciliations** required by paragraph 101.24(a) and (b)?

In case an entity uses exemption in paragraph 101.D8A(b) for oil and gas assets, has it **disclosed**: a) that fact; and b) the basis on which carrying amounts determined under previous GAAP were allocated?
In case exemption in paragraph 101.D8B for operations subject to rate regulation is used, has it **disclosed that fact and the basis on which carrying amounts were determined under previous GAAP**?

If a first-time adopter did not, in its most recent annual financial statements in accordance with previous GAAP, disclose information material to an understanding of the current interim period, has it **disclosed that information in the interim financial report or included a cross-reference to another published document** that includes it?
If an entity applies Ind AS 104, Insurance Contracts, for an earlier period than required, has the entity **disclosed that fact**?

If it is impracticable, when an entity first applies Ind AS 104, to prepare information about claims development that occurred before the beginning of the earliest period for which an entity presents full comparative information that complies with this Ind AS, has the entity **disclosed that fact**?

If aggregating all previously proportionately consolidated assets and liabilities results in negative net assets, and the entity concludes that it does not have legal or constructive obligations in relation to the negative net assets, has the entity **disclosed this fact, along with its cumulative unrecognised share of losses** of its joint ventures at the date of transition to Ind ASs?

Has an entity **disclosed a breakdown of the assets and liabilities that have been aggregated into the single line investment balance** at the date of transition to Ind ASs, prepared in an aggregated manner for all joint ventures at the date of transition to Ind ASs?

Whether the entity has disclosed the number and weighted average exercise prices of share options for each of the following groups of options: (i) Outstanding at the beginning of the period; (ii) Granted during the period; (iii) Forfeited during the period; (iv) Exercised during the period; (v) Expired during the period; (vi) Outstanding at the end of the period; and (vii) Exercisable at the end of the period [2, 3].

(a) Whether the disclosure of weighted average share price at the date of exercise with regards to share options exercised during the period, has been made. (b) Whether the disclosure of the weighted average share price during the period, if options were exercised on a regular basis throughout the period has been given [3].

For share options outstanding at the end of the period, whether the disclosure of the range of exercise prices and weighted average remaining contractual life has been given. (Note: If the range of exercise prices is wide, the outstanding options is divided into ranges that are meaningful for assessing number and timing of additional shares that may be issued and the cash that may be received upon exercise of those options) [4].

Whether the entity has given the disclosure of such information that enables users of the financial statements to understand how the fair value of the goods or services received, or the fair value of the equity instruments granted, during the period was determined [4].

If the information required to be disclosed by this Standard does not satisfy the principles in the disclosure paragraphs, has the entity disclosed such additional information as is necessary to satisfy them [10].

If the specific disclosures required by this and other Ind ASs do not meet the objectives set out in paragraphs 103.59 and 103.61, then whether the entity has provided disclosure of whatever additional information that is necessary to meet those objectives.
Whether an insurer has disclosed information that identifies and explains the amounts in its financial statements arising from insurance contracts [1].
Whether an insurer has disclosed information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature and extent of risks arising from insurance contracts [1].

In case entity committed to a sale plan involving loss of control of a subsidiary, whether the entity has given disclosure of the information required in paragraphs 105.33–105.36 when the subsidiary is a disposal group that meets the definition of a discontinued operation in accordance with paragraph 105.32.

Whether the entity has provided disclosure of the major classes of assets and liabilities if the disposal group is a newly acquired subsidiary that meets the criteria to be classified as held for sale on acquisition (see paragraph 105.11).
Whether the entity has disclosed the information that identifies and explains the amounts recognised in its financial statements arising from the exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources?
Whether the total amount disclosed in accordance with paragraph 107.13C(d) for an instrument is **limited to the amount in paragraph 107.13C(c) for that instrument**?

If the information required by paragraphs 107.13B–107.13E is disclosed by the entity in more than one note to the financial statements, then whether the entity has given **cross-reference between those notes**?

For loans payable recognised at the end of the reporting period, whether the entity has disclosed of: (a) **details of any defaults during the period of principal, interest, sinking fund, or redemption terms of those loans payable**; (b) **the carrying amount of the loans payable in default at the end of the reporting period**; and (c) **whether the default was remedied, or the terms of the loans payable were renegotiated, before the financial statements were approved for issue**?

If, during the period, there were breaches of loan agreement terms other than those described in paragraph 107.18, whether the entity has made **disclosure of the same information as required by paragraph 107.18 if those breaches permitted the lender to demand accelerated repayment** (unless the breaches were remedied, or the terms of the loan were renegotiated, on or before the end of the reporting period)?

Whether the entity has **disclosed the fact and the reason, if the entity believes that the volume of hedging relationships to which the exemption in paragraph 107.23C applies, is unrepresentative of normal volumes during the period** (i.e. the volume at the reporting date does not reflect the volumes during the period)?
Whether the entity has given **disclosure of the information required in paragraph 107.24E separately by risk category**? Disaggregation by risk may be provided in notes to financial statements.

If the quantitative data disclosed as at the end of the reporting period are unrepresentative of the entity’s exposure to risk during the period, whether the **further information that is representative has been provided by the entity**?

If the disclosures provided in accordance with paragraphs 107.35F–107.35N are insufficient to meet the objectives in paragraph 107.35B, whether the entity has provided **disclosure of additional information that is necessary to meet those objectives**?

Whether the entity has provided disclosure of the following, in case the entity does not prepare a sensitivity analysis as described in paragraph 107.41: (a) **a sensitivity analysis for each type of market risk** to which the entity is exposed at the end of the reporting period, showing how profit or loss and equity would have been affected by changes in the relevant risk variable that were reasonably possible at that date; (b) **the methods and assumptions used in preparing the sensitivity analysis**; and (c) **changes from the previous period in the methods and assumptions used, and the reasons for such changes**?
Whether the entity has disclosed **additional information which the entity considers necessary to meet the objectives of paragraph 107.42B**?

Has the entity disclosed information that enables users of financial statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the business activities in which the entity engages and the economic environments in which it operates?
If the necessary geographical information is not available and the cost to develop it would be excessive, has the entity disclosed this fact?

Has the entity provided a detailed description of the methods used to comply with requirements regarding credit risk effects on fair value, explained reasons for non-faithful representation if applicable, and described methodologies for assessing accounting mismatches?
Has the entity disclosed information enabling users to evaluate the effect or potential effect of netting arrangements and rights of set-off on its financial position?
Is the total amount disclosed for instruments subject to netting arrangements limited to their net balance sheet amount?
If netting information is disclosed in more than one note, are cross-references provided between those notes?

For collateral held (financial or non-financial) that the entity is permitted to sell or repledge, has it disclosed the fair value of collateral held, fair value of any sold/repledged collateral with return obligation, and terms/conditions of its use?

For loans payable at period end, has the entity disclosed details of any defaults (principal, interest, etc.), the carrying amount of defaulted loans, and whether defaults were remedied or renegotiated before financial statements approval?
For loan agreement breaches (other than 107.18) that permitted accelerated repayment, has the entity disclosed similar information to defaults, unless remedied or renegotiated by period end?
Are all relevant hedging disclosures presented in a single note or section, or are they adequately cross-referenced if located elsewhere?
Has the entity determined the appropriate level of detail and aggregation for hedging disclosures, ensuring consistency with Ind AS 113 for related fair value information?

Unless exempted, has the entity provided quantitative disclosure by risk category to evaluate hedging instrument terms and conditions, including timing profile of nominal amounts and average price/rate?
If the volume of hedging relationships applying the 107.23C exemption is unrepresentative of normal volumes, has the entity disclosed this fact and the reason?
Has the entity disclosed the information required in paragraph 107.24E separately by risk category, with disaggregation in notes if appropriate?

For hedging relationships applying interest rate benchmark reform exceptions, has the entity disclosed significant interest rate benchmarks, extent of affected risk exposure, transition management, significant assumptions/judgments, and nominal amounts of hedging instruments?

Has the entity provided qualitative disclosures for each risk type (credit, liquidity, market), including risk exposures and their origin, objectives/policies/processes for managing risk, and any changes from the previous period?

Has the entity provided quantitative disclosures for each risk type, including summary data based on internal information, additional disclosures from 107.36-42 (if not already provided), and concentrations of risk (description of determination, shared characteristics, and risk exposure amount)?
If the quantitative risk data disclosed at period end is unrepresentative of the entity's exposure during the period, has the entity provided further representative information?
If disclosures required by 107.35F–107.35N are insufficient to meet the objectives of 107.35B, has the entity provided necessary additional information?

For assets obtained during the period by taking possession of collateral or calling on credit enhancements, has the entity disclosed their nature and carrying amount, and policies for disposal or operational use if not readily convertible to cash?

If a sensitivity analysis (as per 107.41) is not prepared, has the entity disclosed a market risk sensitivity analysis showing P&L/equity effects from reasonably possible risk variable changes, methods/assumptions used, and changes from the prior period?

If a sensitivity analysis reflecting interdependencies (e.g., Value-at-Risk) is prepared and used for financial risk management, has the entity explained the method, main parameters/assumptions, objectives, and limitations?

For each type of continuing involvement, has the entity disclosed for each P&L period: gain/loss at asset transfer date, income/expenses from continuing involvement, and details of concentrated transfer activity during the period (if applicable)?
Has the entity disclosed any additional information it considers necessary to meet the objectives of paragraph 107.42B?

To meet the objective in paragraph 112.1, has the entity disclosed the significant judgements and assumptions made in determining the nature of its interest in another entity or arrangement, the type of joint arrangement in which it has an interest, and if applicable, that it meets the definition of an investment entity [112.2]?

If the disclosures required by Ind AS 112, together with other Ind ASs, do not meet the objective in paragraph 112.1, has the entity disclosed any additional information necessary to meet that objective [112.3]?

Has the entity disclosed information about significant judgements and assumptions made (and changes to them) in determining that it has control of another entity (per 110.5 and 110.6), joint control of an arrangement, or significant influence over another entity, and the type of joint arrangement when structured through a separate vehicle [112.7]?

To address paragraph 112.7, has the entity disclosed significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it does or does not control another entity despite its voting rights, whether it is an agent or principal, or whether it does or does not have significant influence despite its voting rights [112.9]?

If the parent entity determines it is an investment entity, has it disclosed significant judgements and assumptions made in determining this status (per 110.27), and reasons for this conclusion if it lacks typical characteristics (per 110.28) [112.9A]?

Has the entity disclosed information enabling users of consolidated financial statements to understand the group's composition and non-controlling interests' stake (112.12), and to evaluate significant restrictions on asset access/liability settlement (112.13), risks from consolidated structured entities (112.14-112.17), consequences of changes in ownership interest not losing control (112.18), and consequences of losing control (112.19) of a subsidiary [112.10]?

If a subsidiary's financial statements used for consolidation have a different reporting date or period, has the entity disclosed the subsidiary's reporting date and the reason for the difference [112.11]?

For each material subsidiary with non-controlling interests, has the entity disclosed its name, principal place of business, proportion of ownership and voting rights held by non-controlling interests, profit or loss allocated to NCI, accumulated NCI at period-end, and summarised financial information (per 112.B10) [112.12]?

Has the entity disclosed significant restrictions on its ability to access/use group assets and settle liabilities, including restrictions on cash/asset transfers to/from other group entities, guarantees restricting distributions or loan repayments, the nature and extent of NCI protective rights causing such restrictions, and the carrying amounts of assets/liabilities affected by these restrictions [112.13]?

Has the entity disclosed the terms of any contractual arrangements that could require the parent or its subsidiaries to provide financial support to a consolidated structured entity, including events or circumstances that could expose the reporting entity to a loss [112.14]?

If a parent or its subsidiaries provided non-contractual financial or other support to a consolidated structured entity during the period, has the entity disclosed the type and amount of support (including assistance in obtaining financial support) and the reasons for providing it [112.15]?

If a parent or its subsidiaries provided non-contractual support to a previously unconsolidated structured entity during the period, resulting in control, has the entity disclosed an explanation of the relevant factors for that decision [112.16]?
Has the entity disclosed any current intentions to provide financial or other support to a consolidated structured entity, including intentions to assist in obtaining financial support [112.17]?

For each unconsolidated subsidiary, has an investment entity disclosed its name, principal place of business (and country of incorporation if different), and the proportion of ownership interest and, if different, voting rights held [112.19B]?

If an investment entity is the parent of another investment entity, has the parent disclosed the information required by paragraph 112.19B(a)–(c) for investments controlled by its investment entity subsidiary, possibly by including the subsidiary's financial statements [112.19C]?

Has the investment entity disclosed the nature and extent of significant restrictions on an unconsolidated subsidiary's ability to transfer funds (dividends, loan repayments) to the investment entity, and any current commitments or intentions to provide financial or other support to an unconsolidated subsidiary [112.19D]?

If an investment entity or its subsidiaries provided non-contractual financial or other support to an unconsolidated subsidiary during the period, has the entity disclosed the type and amount of support and the reasons for providing it [112.19E]?

Has an investment entity disclosed the terms of any contractual arrangements that could require the entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries to provide financial support to an unconsolidated, controlled, structured entity, including events or circumstances that could expose the reporting entity to a loss [112.19F]?

If an investment entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries provided non-contractual financial or other support to an unconsolidated structured entity (that the investment entity did not control), resulting in control, has the investment entity disclosed an explanation of the relevant factors for that decision [112.19G]?

Has the entity disclosed information enabling users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature, extent, and financial effects of its interests in joint arrangements and associates, including the nature and effects of its contractual relationship with other investors, and the nature of and changes in risks associated with its interests in joint ventures and associates [112.20]?

Has the entity disclosed for each material joint arrangement and associate: its name, nature of relationship, principal place of business, and ownership/voting proportions [112.21(a)]? For material joint ventures and associates, has it disclosed the measurement method (equity or fair value), summarised financial information (per 112.B12, 112.B13), and fair value if equity-method accounted and a quoted price exists [112.21(b)]? For individually immaterial joint ventures and associates, has it disclosed aggregated financial information (per 112.B16) [112.21(c)]? (Note: Investment entities are explicitly stated as not needing to provide disclosures required by paragraphs 112.21(b)-(c)).
Has an investment entity provided the disclosures required by paragraphs 112.21(b)–112.21(c) [112.21A]?

Has the entity disclosed information enabling users to understand the nature and extent of its interests in unconsolidated structured entities and to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, risks associated with those interests [112.24]? (Note: Investment entities may be exempt from this disclosure for unconsolidated structured entities they control and for which they provide disclosures under 112.19A–112.19G).

Has the entity disclosed qualitative and quantitative information about its interests in unconsolidated structured entities, including their nature, purpose, size, activities, and financing [112.26]? If the entity sponsored an unconsolidated structured entity and does not provide other required information for it, has it disclosed how sponsored entities were determined, income from them (preferably tabular), and carrying amount of transferred assets (preferably tabular) [112.27]?

If the entity provided non-contractual financial or other support to an unconsolidated structured entity (in which it had an interest) during the period, has it disclosed the type and amount of support (including assistance in obtaining financial support) and the reasons for providing it [112.30]?
Has the entity disclosed any current intentions to provide financial or other support to an unconsolidated structured entity, including intentions to assist in obtaining financial support [112.31]?

Is the summarised financial information per 112.B12 and 112.B13 based on the joint venture's or associate's Ind AS financial statements (not the entity's share) [112.B14(a)]? If the equity method is used, has the entity disclosed adjusted amounts (for fair value/policy differences) and a reconciliation to the carrying amount of its interest [112.B14(b)]?
Has the entity disclosed the basis on which the summarised financial information has been prepared [112.B15]?
Has the entity disclosed, in aggregate, the carrying amount of its interests in all individually immaterial joint ventures or associates that are accounted for using the equity method [112.B16]?

Has the entity disclosed total unrecognised commitments at the reporting date (including its share of jointly made commitments) related to its interests in joint ventures, which may give rise to future cash or resource outflows [112.B18]?
In addition to information required by paragraphs 112.29–112.31, has the entity disclosed any additional information necessary to meet the disclosure objective in paragraph 112.24(b) [112.B25]?

If the entity recognizes regulatory deferral account balances, has it disclosed, in addition to other specified information (112.12, 112.21, 112.B10, 112.B12-112.B13, 112.B16), the total regulatory deferral account debit balance, total credit balance, and net movements split by profit or loss and other comprehensive income, for each entity requiring Ind AS 112 disclosures [112.B27]?

When recognizing a gain or loss on losing control of a subsidiary (calculated per 110.25), has the entity disclosed the information specified by paragraph 112.19 [112.B28(a)]? Additionally, if electing to apply this Standard, has it disclosed the portion of that gain or loss attributable to derecognizing regulatory deferral account balances in the former subsidiary at the control loss date [112.B28(b)]?
Whether the entity has disclosed and also consistently followed the policy for determining the transfers between levels in the fair value hierarchy that are deemed to have occurred.
If an entity has made an accounting policy decision to use the exception in paragraph 113.48, has it disclosed the same.

Whether the entity has made disclosure of the information required by paragraph 113.93(b)-(d) for each class of assets and liabilities not measured at fair value but for which the fair value is disclosed. Note: However, the entity is not required to provide the quantitative disclosures about significant unobservable inputs used in Fair Value measurements categorised within Level 3 of the Fair Value hierarchy required by paragraph 113.93(d). For such assets and liabilities, the entity does not need to provide the other disclosures required by this Ind AS.

If any of the disclosures set out in paragraphs 114.30–114.36 are not considered relevant to meet the objective in paragraph 114.27, they may be omitted from the financial statements. If the disclosures provided in accordance with paragraphs 114.30–114.36 are insufficient to meet the objective in paragraph 114.27, then whether the entity has given disclosure of additional information that is necessary to meet that objective.

(a) Whether the disclosures required by paragraph 114.30 has been given in the financial statements either directly in the notes or incorporated by cross-reference from the financial statements to some other statement, such as a management commentary or risk report, that is available to users of the financial statements on the same terms as the financial statements and at the same time. Note: If the information is not included in the financial statements directly or incorporated by cross-reference, the financial statements are incomplete.

When an entity provides disclosures in accordance with Ind AS 112 Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities, for an interest in a subsidiary, associate or joint venture that has rate-regulated activities and for which regulatory deferral account balances are recognised in accordance with this Standard, whether the entity has provided disclosure of the amounts that are included for the regulatory deferral account debit and credit balances and the net movement in those balances for the interests disclosed (see paragraphs 114.B25–114.B28).

When an entity concludes that a regulatory deferral account balance is no longer fully recoverable or reversible, then whether the entity has disclosed that fact, the reason why it is not recoverable or reversible and the amount by which the regulatory deferral account balance has been reduced.

If the entity chooses to include the regulatory deferral account balances and movements in those balances that are related to the disposal group or discontinued operation within the related regulated deferral account line items, whether the entity has disclosed them separately as part of the analysis of the regulatory deferral account line items described by paragraph 114.33.

(a) Whether the entity has given the disclosure required by paragraph 112.12(e) for each of its subsidiaries that have non-controlling interests that are material to the reporting entity, of the profit or loss that was allocated to non-controlling interests of the subsidiary during the reporting period. (b) In case an entity that recognises regulatory deferral account balances in accordance with this Standard, whether the entity has made disclosure of the net movement in regulatory deferral account balances that is included within the amounts that are required to be disclosed by paragraph Ind AS 112.12(e).

In addition to the information specified in paragraphs 112.12, 112.21, 112.B10, 112.B12–112.B13 and 112.B16, in case entity recognises regulatory deferral account balances in accordance with this Standard, whether the entity has provided disclosure of i. the total regulatory deferral account debit balance, ii. the total regulatory deferral account credit balance and iii. the net movements in those balances, split between amounts recognised in profit or loss and amounts recognised as other comprehensive income, for each entity for which those Ind AS 112 disclosures are required.

(a) Whether an entity has disclosed the information specified by paragraph 112.19 when the entity recognises a gain or loss on losing control of a subsidiary, calculated in accordance with paragraph 110.25. (b) In addition to the information required by paragraph 112.19, in case an entity elects to apply this Standard, whether it has provided disclosure of the portion of that gain or loss that is attributable to derecognising regulatory deferral account balances in the former subsidiary at the date when control is lost.

If an entity uses an alternative description for a contract asset, whether the entity provided sufficient information for a user of the financial statements to distinguish between receivables and contract assets [2]?

Whether the entity has provided disclosure of qualitative and quantitative information about all of the following: (a) its contracts with customers (see paragraphs 115.113–115.122) [2]; (b) the significant judgements, and changes in the judgements, made in applying this Standard to those contracts (see paragraphs 115.123–115.126) [2]; and (c) any assets recognised from the costs to obtain or fulfil a contract with a customer in accordance with paragraph 115.91 or 115.95 (see paragraphs 115.127–115.128) [3]?

Whether the entity has provided appropriate explanation about how the timing of satisfaction of its performance obligations (see paragraph 115.119(a)) relates to the typical timing of payment (see paragraph 115.119(b)) and the effect that those factors have on the contract asset and the contract liability balances [5]?
Whether the entity has provided explanation about the significant changes in the contract asset and the contract liability balances during the reporting period [5]?

Whether the entity has given disclosure of information about entity’s performance obligations in contracts with customers, including a description of all of the following: (a) when the entity typically satisfies its performance obligations including when performance obligations are satisfied in a bill-and-hold arrangement [5]; (b) the significant payment terms [5]; (c) the nature of the goods or services that the entity has promised to transfer, highlighting any performance obligations to arrange for another party to transfer goods or services (ie if the entity is acting as an agent) [6]; (d) obligations for returns, refunds and other similar obligations [6]; and (e) types of warranties and related obligations [6]?

Has the entity explained qualitatively that whether it is applying the practical expedient in paragraph 121 and whether any consideration from contracts with customers is not included in the transaction price and, therefore, not included in the information disclosed in accordance with paragraph 120 [6]?

Whether the entity has disclosed the significant judgements that it has made in evaluating when a customer obtains control of promised goods or services for the performance obligations satisfied at a point in time [8]?

Whether the entity disclosed the information about the methods, inputs and assumptions used for all of the following: (a) determining the transaction price, which includes, but is not limited to, estimating variable consideration, adjusting the consideration for the effects of the time value of money and measuring non-cash consideration [8]; (b) assessing whether an estimate of variable consideration is constrained [8]; (c) allocating the transaction price, including estimating stand-alone selling prices of promised goods or services and allocating discounts and variable consideration to a specific part of the contract (if applicable) [9]; and (d) measuring obligations for returns, refunds and other similar obligations [9]?

Whether an entity has described both of the following: (a) the judgements made in determining the amount of the costs incurred to obtain or fulfil a contract with a customer (in accordance with paragraph 115.91 or 115.95) [9]; and (b) the method it uses to determine the amortisation for each reporting period [9]?

If the entity has elected practical expedient in paragraph 115.63 (about the existence of a significant financing component) or paragraph 115.94 (about the incremental costs of obtaining a contract), whether it has disclosed that fact [10]?

For any of the practical expedients in paragraph 115.C5 that an entity uses, it shall apply that expedient consistently to all contracts within all reporting periods presented. In addition, whether it has disclosed all of the following information: (a) the expedients that have been used [10]; and (b) to the extent reasonably possible, a qualitative assessment of the estimated effect of applying each of those expedients [11]?

An entity applying this Standard retrospectively in accordance with paragraph 115.C3(b) may also use the practical expedient described in paragraph 115.C5(c), either: (a) for all contract modifications that occur before the beginning of the earliest period presented; or (b) for all contract modifications that occur before the date of initial application. If an entity uses this practical expedient, whether the entity has applied the expedient consistently to all contracts and disclosed the information required by paragraph 115.C6 [11]?

In addition to the disclosures required in paragraphs 116.53–116.58, whether the disclosure of additional qualitative and quantitative information about leasing activities necessary to meet the disclosure objective in paragraph 116.51 (as described in paragraph 116.B48) has been given [5].
Whether disclosures specified in paragraph 116.90 has been provided in a tabular format, unless another format is more appropriate [7].
Whether the entity has given disclosure of the additional qualitative and quantitative information about leasing activities necessary to meet the disclosure objective in paragraph 116.89 [7].

Whether additional information have been provided relating to extension options or termination options that, depending on the circumstances, may be needed to satisfy the disclosure objective in paragraph 116.51 [10].

Whether additional information have been provided relating to residual value guarantees that, depending on the circumstances, may be needed to satisfy the disclosure objective in paragraph 116.51 [10].
Whether entity provided disclosures related to temporary differences associated with investments in subsidiaries, branches and associates or interests in joint arrangements?
Has the entity disclosed the existence and amounts of restrictions on title, and PPE pledged as security for liabilities?
Has the entity disclosed the amount of contractual commitments for the acquisition of PPE?
Has the entity provided disclosure for accumulated depreciation at the end of the period?

In case of a change in an accounting estimate in accordance with Ind AS 8 that affects the current or future periods, has the entity disclosed information regarding residual values, estimated costs of dismantling/removing/restoring PPE, useful lives, and depreciation methods?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the carrying amount of temporarily idle PPE?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the gross carrying amount of any fully depreciated PPE that is still in use?
Has the entity voluntarily disclosed the carrying amount of PPE retired from active use and not classified as held for sale in accordance with Ind AS 105?
Whether the entity has disclosed the amount recognised as an expense for defined contribution plans?
Where required by Ind AS 24, whether the entity has disclosed the information about contributions to defined contribution plans for key management personnel?

If the disclosures provided in accordance with the requirements in this Standard and other Ind ASs are insufficient to meet the objectives under 19.135, whether the entity has disclosure of additional information necessary to meet those objectives be given?
Whether the entity has assessed as to whether all or some disclosures should be disaggregated to distinguish plans or groups of plans with materially different risks?

Whether the entity has given disclosure of: (a) information about the characteristics of its defined benefit plans, including: (i) the nature of the benefits provided by the plan. (ii) a description of the regulatory framework in which the plan operates (see paragraph 19.64). (iii) a description of any other entity’s responsibilities for the governance of the plan. (b) a description of the risks to which the plan exposes the entity, focused on any unusual, entity specific or plan-specific risks, and of any significant concentrations of risk. (c) a description of any plan amendments, curtailments and settlements?

Whether a reconciliation from the opening balance to the closing balance for each of the following, if applicable have been provided: (a) the net defined benefit liability (asset), showing separate reconciliations for: (i) plan assets. (ii) the present value of the defined benefit obligation. (iii) the effect of the asset ceiling. (b) any reimbursement rights. An entity shall also describe the relationship between any reimbursement right and the related obligation?

Whether the entity has disclosed the significant actuarial assumptions used to determine the present value of the defined benefit obligation (paragraph 19.76). Whether such disclosure has been given in absolute terms. In case disclosures are provided in total for a grouping of plans, whether such disclosures are provided in the form of weighted averages or relatively narrow ranges?

Whether the entity has made disclosure of: (a) a sensitivity analysis for each significant actuarial assumption (as disclosed under paragraph 19.144) as of the end of the reporting period, showing how the defined benefit obligation would have been affected by changes in the relevant actuarial assumption that were reasonably possible at that date. (b) the methods and assumptions used in preparing the sensitivity analyses required by (a) and the limitations of those methods. (c) changes from the previous period in the methods and assumptions used in preparing the sensitivity analyses, and the reasons for such changes?

Whether the entity disclosed a description of any asset-liability matching strategies used by the plan or the entity, including the use of annuities and other techniques, such as longevity swaps, to manage risk?

If an entity participates in a multi-employer defined benefit plan, then whether it has provided disclosure of: (a) a description of the funding arrangements, including the method used to determine the entity’s rate of contributions and any minimum funding requirements. (b) a description of the extent to which the entity can be liable to the plan for other entities’ obligations under the terms and conditions of the multi-employer plan. (c) a description of any agreed allocation of a deficit or surplus on: (i) wind-up of the plan; or (ii) the entity’s withdrawal from the plan. (d) if the entity accounts for that plan as if it were a defined contribution plan in accordance with paragraph 19.34, whether it has disclosed the following, in addition to the information required by (a)–(c) and instead of the information required by paragraphs 19.139– 19.147: (i) the fact that the plan is a defined benefit plan (ii) the reason why sufficient information is not available to enable the entity to account for the plan as a defined benefit plan. (iii) the expected contributions to the plan for the next annual reporting period. (iv) information about any deficit or surplus in the plan that may affect the amount of future contributions, including the basis used to determine that deficit or surplus and the implications, if any, for the entity. (v) an indication of the level of participation of the entity in the plan compared with other participating entities?

If an entity participates in a defined benefit plan that shares risks between entities under common control, whether the entity has disclosed: (a) the contractual agreement or stated policy for charging the net defined benefit cost or the fact that there is no such policy. (b) the policy for determining the contribution to be paid by the entity. (c) if the entity accounts for an allocation of the net defined benefit cost as noted in paragraph 19.41, all the information about the plan as a whole required by paragraphs 19.135–19.147. (d) if the entity accounts for the contribution payable for the period as noted in paragraph 19.41, the information about the plan as a whole required by paragraphs 19.135–19.137, 19.139, 19.142–19.144 and 19.147(a) and (b)?

Whether the information required by Paragraph 149 (c) and (d) is disclosed by cross-reference to disclosures in another group entity’s Financial Statement if: a) that group entity’s Financial Statements separately identify and disclose the information required about the plan; and b) that group entity’s Financial Statements are available to users of the Financial Statements on the same terms as the Financial Statements of the entity and at the same time as, or earlier than, the Financial Statements of the entity?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of **the accounting policies adopted in measuring inventories**, including the **cost formula used**?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of **the amount of inventories recognised as an expense during the period**?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of **the circumstances or events that led to the reversal of a write-down of inventories** in accordance with paragraph 2.34?

In case the entity adopts a format for profit and loss that results in amounts being disclosed other than the cost of inventories recognized as an expense during the period and the entity presents an analysis of expenses using a classification based on the nature of expenses, then whether the entity has given disclosures of **the costs recognized as an expense for raw materials and consumables, labour costs and other costs together with the amount of the net change in inventories for the period**?

Has the entity disclosed the nature and extent of government grants recognised in the financial statements and an indication of other forms of government assistance from which the entity has directly benefited?
Has the entity disclosed any unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government assistance that has been recognised?

Has the entity disclosed **net exchange differences recognised in other comprehensive income and accumulated in a separate component of equity**, along with a reconciliation of such exchange differences at the beginning and end of the period?
Has the entity disclosed the **amount of borrowing costs capitalised** during the period?
Has the entity disclosed the **capitalisation rate used** to determine the amount of borrowing costs eligible for capitalisation?

Has the entity disclosed the **relationship between parent and its subsidiaries**, irrespective of whether there have been transactions between them, and the **name of the parent and, if different, the ultimate controlling party** (or the next most senior parent if applicable)?

If the exemption available in paragraph 24.25 (for government-related entities) is availed, has the entity disclosed: **The name of the government and the nature of its relationship** with the reporting entity, the **nature and amount of each individually significant transaction**, and for other collectively but not individually significant transactions, a **qualitative or quantitative indication of their extent**?
If the parent entity has elected not to prepare consolidated financial statements, has it described the method used to account for the listed investments?
Whether the entity has disclosed the identity and level of the price index at the end of the reporting period and the movement in the index during the current and the previous reporting period?
Whether the entity has disclosed the duration of the hyperinflationary situation existing in the economy?

Whether the amount of treasury shares held is disclosed separately either in the balance sheet or in the notes, in accordance with Ind AS 1. Whether the entity provides disclosure in accordance with Ind AS 24 if the entity reacquires its own equity instruments from related parties?
DISCLOSURE_GENERAL.reference: Ind AS 32.34, Ind AS 1, Ind AS 24

DISCLOSURE_GENERAL.question: Does the entity disclose the fact that per share calculations reflect changes in the number of ordinary or potential ordinary shares outstanding due to capitalisation, bonus issue, share split, or reverse share split, and are basic and diluted EPS adjusted retrospectively for errors and accounting policy changes?

Does the entity provide an explanation of events and transactions that are significant to an understanding of the changes in financial position and performance of the entity since the end of the last annual reporting period, updating relevant information?

Does the entity disclose whether the same accounting policies and methods of computation are followed in the interim financial statements as compared with the most recent annual financial statements, or, if changed, provide a description of the nature and effect of the change?

Has the entity made disclosures required under Ind AS 10, Events after the Reporting Period, if a restructuring plan is started or its main features are announced after the reporting period but before the financial statements are approved for issue, and the restructuring is material and non-disclosure could reasonably be expected to influence decisions made by primary users of general purpose financial statements [1]?
Has the entity disclosed the fact that any information required by paragraphs 37.86 and 37.89 is not disclosed because it is not practicable to do so [6]?

In extremely rare cases where disclosure of some or all of the information required by paragraphs 37.84–37.89 can be expected to prejudice seriously the entity's position in a dispute, has the entity disclosed the general nature of the dispute, together with the fact that, and reason why, the information has not been disclosed [6]?
Has the contributor disclosed the nature of its interest in a fund and any restrictions on access to the assets in the fund [7]?
Have the disclosures given under paragraph 37.86 been provided when a contributor has an obligation to make potential additional contributions that is not recognised as a liability [7]?
Have the disclosures required by paragraph 37.85(c) been made when a contributor accounts for its interest in the fund [7]?
Whether the entity has disclosed the aggregate amount of research and development expenditure recognised as an expense during the period?

Agricultural activity is often exposed to climatic, disease and other natural risks. If an event occurs that gives rise to a material item of income or expense, does the entity disclose the following in accordance with Ind AS 1: a) the **nature**; and b) **amount of that item**?

Does the entity disclose the following related to agricultural activity covered by the Standard: a) **nature and extent of government grants recognised in the financial statements**; b) unfulfilled conditions and other contingencies attaching to government grants; c) significant decreases expected in the level of government grants?

Whether an entity has made disclosure, in aggregate, in respect of both obtaining and losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses during the period, each of the following: a) the total consideration paid or received; b) the portion of the consideration consisting of cash and cash equivalents; c) the amount of cash and cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or other businesses over which control is obtained or lost; and d) the amount of the assets and liabilities other than cash or cash equivalents in the subsidiaries or other businesses over which control is obtained or lost, summarised by each major category?

If an entity provides the disclosure required by paragraph 7.44A in combination with disclosures of changes in other assets and liabilities, whether the entity has disclosed the changes in liabilities arising from financing activities separately from changes in those other assets and liabilities?
Whether the entity has disclosed the components of cash and cash equivalents?

Whether an entity has made disclosure, together with a commentary by management, of the amount of significant cash and cash equivalent balances held by the entity that are not available for use by the group?

Whether the entity has disclosed the fact and known or reasonably estimable information relevant to assessing the possible impact that application of a new Ind AS (that has been issued but is not yet effective) will have on its financial statements in the period of initial application?

Whether the entity has disclosed, in complying with paragraph 8.30, the following: a) the title of the new Ind AS; b) the nature of the impending change or changes in accounting policy; c) the date by which application of the Ind AS is required; d) the date as at which it plans to apply the Ind AS initially; and e) either a discussion of the impact that initial application of the Ind AS is expected to have on the entity’s financial statements, or a statement to that effect if the impact is not known or reasonably estimable?

Whether the entity has disclosed the nature and amount of a change in an accounting estimate that has an effect in the current period or is expected to have an effect in future periods, except for the disclosure of the effect on future periods when it is impracticable to estimate that effect?
Whether the entity has disclosed the fact that the amount of the effect in future periods is not disclosed because estimating it is impracticable?
Does the entity disclose a description of each service concession arrangement (or, if aggregated, each class of arrangement)?
Does the entity disclose its rights and obligations to acquire or build items of property, plant and equipment under each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose its obligations to deliver, or rights to receive, specified assets at the end of the concession period?
Does the entity disclose renewal and termination options and the associated rights and obligations under each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose any other significant rights and obligations arising from each arrangement?
Does the entity disclose any changes in each arrangement that occurred during the reporting period?

DISCLOSURE_FINANCIAL_POSITION.question: Does the entity disclose a description of the significant terms of each arrangement that may affect the amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows (for example, the period of the concession, the date of the next renegotiation, and whether payments are variable or fixed)?
Does the entity disclose material uncertainties related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt upon the entity's ability to continue as a going concern?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the fact that the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the basis on which the financial statements are prepared?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the reason why the entity is not regarded as a going concern?

Do the notes to the financial statements disclose the information required by IFRS accounting standards that is not presented in the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity or the statement of cash flows?

Do the notes to the financial statements disclose information that is not presented in the statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity or the statement of cash flows, but is relevant to an understanding of any of them?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of cash flows to any related information in the notes?
Does the entity disclose any tax-related contingent liabilities and contingent assets in accordance with IAS 37?
Does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 19.147 to indicate the effect of the defined benefit plan on its future cash flows?
Where required by IAS 37, does the entity disclose contingent liabilities arising from post-employment benefit obligations?
If there are related party transactions during the period, does the entity disclose the nature of each related party relationship?

Does the entity disclose information about related party transactions and outstanding balances, including commitments, necessary for an understanding of their potential effect on the financial statements, specifically: the amount of the transactions; the amount of outstanding balances, including commitments; their terms and conditions (including whether secured and the nature of consideration to be provided); details of any guarantees given or received; provisions for doubtful debts related to outstanding balances; and the expense recognised for bad or doubtful debts due from related parties?
If the entity reports segment information, does it disclose the reportable segment to which the impaired or reversed asset belongs?
For a cash-generating unit, does the entity provide a description of that unit (such as product line, plant, business operation, geographical area or reportable segment)?
Does the entity disclose the discount rate(s) applied to the cash flow projections?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the reporting period?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose additional provisions made in the reporting period, including increases to existing provisions?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose amounts used (incurred and charged against the provision) during the reporting period?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose unused amounts reversed during the reporting period?

For each class of provision, does the entity disclose the increase during the reporting period in the discounted amount arising from the passage of time and the effect of any change in the discount rate?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose the nature of the obligation and the expected timing of any resulting outflows of economic benefits?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose the uncertainties about the amount or timing of those outflows?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose, if necessary to provide adequate information, the major assumptions made concerning future events?
For each class of provision, does the entity disclose the amount of any expected reimbursement, stating the amount of any asset recognised for that expected reimbursement?
Unless the possibility of any outflow in settlement is remote, does the entity disclose the nature of each contingent liability at the end of the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose the uncertainties relating to the amount or timing of any outflow for each contingent liability?
Does the entity disclose the possibility of any reimbursement for each contingent liability?

If a provision and a contingent liability arise from the same circumstances, does the entity disclose the information required by IAS 37.84–86 in a way that shows the link between the provision and the contingent liability?
If an inflow of economic benefits is probable, does the entity disclose the nature of each contingent asset at the end of the reporting period?
Does the entity classify interest paid (as described in IAS 7.32) as cash flows from financing activities?

Cash flows arising from taxes on income must be separately disclosed and must be classified as cash flows from operating activities unless they can be specifically identified with financing and investing activities. If the entity allocates tax cash flows to more than one class of activity, does the entity disclose the total amount of taxes paid?
Does the entity disclose changes from financing cash flows affecting liabilities arising from financing activities?

If the entity discloses the information required by IAS 7.44A by providing a reconciliation between the opening and closing balances in the statement of financial position for liabilities arising from financing activities, does it provide sufficient information to enable users of the financial statements to link items included in the reconciliation to the statement of financial position and the statement of cash flows?
Does the entity disclose that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with its transitional provisions, if applicable?
Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions, if applicable?
Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions that might have an effect on future periods, if applicable?
Does the entity disclose material uncertainties related to events or conditions that may cast significant doubt upon its ability to continue as a going concern?
Does the entity disclose the fact that the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis?
Does the entity disclose the basis on which the financial statements are prepared if not on a going concern basis?
Does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?
Does the entity disclose that the change in accounting policy is made in accordance with its transitional provisions, if applicable?
Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions, if applicable?
Does the entity disclose the transitional provisions that might have an effect on future periods, if applicable?
Does the entity explain how the transition from previous GAAP to IFRS accounting standards affected its financial position, financial performance and cash flows?
If an entity applies the transition provisions in IFRS 15.C5, does it make the disclosures required by IFRS 15.C6?

Does the entity disclose contingent liabilities incurred relating to its interests in joint ventures, including its share of contingent liabilities incurred jointly with other investors, separately from other contingent liabilities?

Does the entity disclose enough information to understand the composition of the group, including the group’s composition and the interest that non-controlling interests have in the group’s activities and cash flows?

Does the entity disclose contingent liabilities relating to its interests in joint ventures, including its share of jointly incurred contingent liabilities, separately from other contingent liabilities?
Does the entity disclose the effects of that rate regulation on its financial position, financial performance and cash flows?
For each type of rate-regulated activity, does the entity disclose the identity of the rate regulator(s), and if the regulator is a related party, does it explain that relationship?

If an entity uses the premium allocation approach, does it also disclose: a. Which of the criteria in IFRS 17.53 and IFRS 17.69 it has satisfied b. Whether it makes an adjustment for the time value of money and the effect of financial risk applying IFRS 17.56, 57(b) and 59(b) c. The method it has chosen to recognise insurance acquisition cash flows applying IFRS 17.59(a)

Does the entity disclose reconciliations that show how the net carrying amounts of contracts within the scope of IFRS 17 changed during the period because of cash flows and income and expenses recognised in the statement(s) of financial performance, separately for insurance contracts issued and reinsurance contracts held

An entity shall provide enough information in the reconciliations to enable users of financial statements to identify changes from cash flows and amounts that are recognised in the statement(s) of financial performance. To comply with this requirement, does it: a. Disclose, in a table, the reconciliations set out in IFRS 17.100–105B b. For each reconciliation, present the net carrying amounts at the beginning and at the end of the period, disaggregated into a total for portfolios of contracts that are assets and a total for portfolios of contracts that are liabilities, that equal the amounts presented in the statement of financial position applying IFRS 17.78

Does the entity disclose reconciliations from the opening to the closing balances separately for each of: a. The net liabilities (or assets) for the remaining coverage component, excluding any loss component b. Any loss component (see IFRS 17.47–52 and 57–58) c. The liabilities for incurred claims d. For insurance contracts to which the premium allocation approach described in IFRS 17.53–59 or 69–70A has been applied, does the entity disclose reconciliations from the opening to the closing balances separately for each of: ► The estimates of the present value of the future cash flows ► The risk adjustment for non-financial risk

For insurance contracts other than those to which the premium allocation approach described in IFRS 17.53–59 or 69–70A has been applied, does the entity also disclose reconciliations from the opening to the closing balances separately for each of: a. The estimates of the present value of the future cash flows b. The risk adjustment for non-financial risk c. The contractual service margin

Does the entity separately disclose in the reconciliations required in IFRS 17.101 each of the following amounts related to insurance services, if applicable: a. Changes that relate to future service, applying IFRS 17. B96–B118, showing separately: ► Changes in estimates that adjust the contractual service margin ► Changes in estimates that do not adjust the contractual service margin, i.e., losses on groups of onerous contracts and reversals of such losses b. Changes in the risk adjustment for non-financial risk, showing separately: ► Amounts that relate to future service ► Amounts that relate to past service c. Changes that relate to past service, i.e., changes in fulfilment cash flows relating to incurred claims (see IFRS 17.B97(b) and B113(a))

To complete the reconciliations in IFRS 17.100–101, does the entity also disclose separately each of the following amounts not related to services provided in the period, if applicable: a. Cash flows in the period, including: ► Premiums received for insurance contracts issued (or paid for reinsurance contracts held) ...

Does an entity disclose a reconciliation from the opening to the closing balance of assets for insurance acquisition cash flows recognised applying IFRS 17.28B, and does the entity aggregate information for the reconciliation at a level that is consistent with that for the reconciliation of insurance contracts, applying IFRS 17.98
Does an entity disclose quantitatively, in appropriate time bands, when it expects to derecognise an asset for insurance acquisition cash flows applying IFRS 17.28C

For contracts with direct participation features, if an entity chooses not to adjust the contractual service margin for some changes in the fulfilment cash flows, applying IFRS 17.B115, does it disclose the effect of that choice on the adjustment to the contractual service margin in the current period

Specifically, does the entity disclose the inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used, including: a. The methods used to measure insurance contracts within the scope of IFRS 17 and the processes for estimating the inputs to those methods ► Unless impracticable, does the entity also provide quantitative information about those inputs b. Any changes in the methods and processes for estimating inputs used to measure contracts, including: ► The reason for each change ► The type of contracts affected c. To the extent not covered in IFRS 17.117(a) above, the approach used: ► To distinguish changes in estimates of future cash flows arising from the exercise of discretion from other changes in estimates of future cash flows for contracts without direct participation features (see IFRS 17.B98) ► To determine the risk adjustment for non-financial risk, including whether changes in the risk adjustment for non-financial risk are disaggregated into an insurance service component and an insurance finance component ► To determine discount rates ► To determine investment components ► To determine the relative weighting of the benefits provided by insurance coverage and investment-return service or by insurance coverage and investment-related service (see IFRS 17.B119–B119B)
Does the entity disclose the yield curve (or range of yield curves) used to discount cash flows that do not vary based on the returns on underlying items when applying IFRS 17.36

Does the entity disclose information that enables users of its financial statements to evaluate the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows that arise from contracts within the scope of IFRS 17
Does the entity disclose material uncertainties that may cast significant doubt on its ability to continue as a going concern?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose that fact?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the basis on which they are prepared?
If the financial statements are not prepared on a going concern basis, does the entity disclose the reason why it is not regarded as a going concern?
Does the entity cross-reference each item in the statement of cash flows to any related information in the notes?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date fair value of liabilities incurred (e.g., contingent consideration)?
Has the entity disclosed the amount recognised for each contingent consideration arrangement at the acquisition date?
Has the entity described each contingent consideration arrangement and the basis for determining payment?
Has the entity estimated the range of undiscounted outcomes for contingent consideration or, if not, disclosed that fact and the reasons?
If the maximum contingent consideration payment is unlimited, has the entity disclosed that fact?
Has the entity disclosed its best estimate of contractual cash flows not expected to be collected, by major class of receivable?
For each contingent liability recognised under IFRS 3.23, has the entity disclosed the information required by IAS 37.85?
