Whether the entity has given disclosure of the following quantitative disclosures for each type of risk (credit risk, liquidity risk and market risk) arising from financial instruments: (a) **summary quantitative data about its exposure to that risk at the end of the reporting period** (This disclosure shall be based on the information provided internally to key management personnel of the entity (as defined in Ind AS 24, Related Party Disclosures)); (b) **the disclosures required by paragraphs 107.36-107.42**, to the extent not provided in (a) above; and (c) **concentrations of risk if not apparent from the disclosures made in accordance with (a) and (b)** which shall include: (i) a description of how management determines concentrations; (ii) a description of the shared characteristic that identifies each concentration; and (iii) the amount of the risk exposure associated with all financial instruments sharing that characteristic?

Whether the entity has given disclosures under paragraphs 107.35F-107.35N required to be provided for financial instruments to which the impairment requirements in Ind AS 109 are applied? However: (a) for trade receivables, contract assets and lease receivables, paragraph 107.35J(a) applies to those trade receivables, contract assets or lease receivables on which lifetime expected credit losses are recognised in accordance with paragraph 109.5.5.15, if those financial assets are modified while more than 30 days past due; and (b) paragraph 107.35K(b) does not apply to lease receivables?

Whether the entity has provided disclosure of the following with the objective of enabling users of financial statements to understand the effect of credit risk on the amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows: (a) **information about the entity’s credit risk management practices and how they relate to the recognition and measurement of expected credit losses**, including the methods, assumptions and information used to measure expected credit losses; (b) **quantitative and qualitative information that allows users of financial statements to evaluate the amounts in the financial statements arising from expected credit losses**, including changes in the amount of expected credit losses and the reasons for those changes; and (c) **information about the entity’s credit risk exposure** (i.e. the credit risk inherent in an entity’s financial assets and commitments to extend credit) including significant credit risk concentrations? (Note: If the above information is disclosed elsewhere, it needs to be adequately cross-referenced).

Whether the entity provided disclosure of the following to explain the inputs assumptions and estimation techniques used to apply the requirements in section 5.5 of Ind AS 109: (a) **the basis of inputs and assumptions and the estimation techniques used to**: (i) measure the 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses; (ii) determine whether the credit risk of financial instruments has increased significantly since initial recognition; and (iii) determine whether a financial asset is a credit-impaired financial asset; (b) **how forward-looking information has been incorporated into the determination of expected credit losses**, including the use of macroeconomic information; and (c) **changes in the estimation techniques or significant assumptions made during the reporting period and the reasons for those changes**?

Whether the entity has disclosed an **explanation of how significant changes in the gross carrying amount of financial instruments contributed to changes in the loss allowance** for each class of financial instrument, including relevant qualitative and quantitative information provided separately for financial instruments that represent the loss allowance as disclosed in paragraph 107.35H(a)-(c)?

Whether the entity has disclosed the following, by class of financial instrument with the objective of enabling users of financial statements to understand the effect of collateral and other credit enhancements on the amounts arising from expected credit losses: (a) **the amount that best represents its maximum exposure to credit risk at the end of the reporting period without taking account of any collateral held or other credit enhancements** (e.g. netting agreements that do not qualify for offset in accordance with Ind AS 32); (b) **a narrative description of collateral held as security and other credit enhancements**, including: (i) a description of the nature and quality of the collateral held; (ii) an explanation of any significant changes in the quality of that collateral or credit enhancements as a result of deterioration or changes in the collateral policies of the entity during the reporting period; and (iii) information about financial instruments for which an entity has not recognised a loss allowance because of the collateral; (c) **quantitative information about the collateral held as security and other credit enhancements for financial assets that are credit-impaired at the reporting date**?
Whether the entity has given disclosure of the **contractual amount outstanding on financial assets that were written off during the reporting period and are still subject to enforcement activity**?

Whether the entity has given disclosure of, **the gross carrying amount of financial assets and the exposure to credit risk on loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts, by credit risk rating grades**, to enable users of financial statements to assess the entity’s credit risk exposure and understand its significant credit risk concentrations separately for the following financial instruments: (a) for which the loss allowance is measured at an amount equal to 12-month expected credit losses; (b) for which the loss allowance is measured at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses (gross carrying amount of financial instruments to be separately disclosed for which lifetime ECL have been measured on a collective basis) and that are: (i) financial instruments for which credit risk has increased significantly since initial recognition but that are not credit-impaired financial assets; (ii) financial assets that are credit-impaired at the reporting date (but that are not purchased or originated credit-impaired); and (iii) trade receivables, contract assets or lease receivables for which the loss allowances are measured in accordance with paragraph 109.5.5.15; (c) that are purchased or originated credit-impaired financial assets? (Note: For trade receivables, contract assets and lease receivables to which an entity applies paragraph 109.5.5.15, the information provided in paragraph 107.35M may be based on a provision matrix (see paragraph 109.B5.5.35)).

Whether the entity has provided disclosure of the following by class of financial instrument for all financial instruments within the scope of Ind AS 107, but to which the impairment requirements in Ind AS 109 are not applied: (a) **the amount that best represents its maximum exposure to credit risk at the end of the reporting period without taking account of any collateral held or other credit enhancements** (e.g. netting agreements that do not qualify for offset in accordance with Ind AS 32); this disclosure is not required for financial instruments whose carrying amount best represents the maximum exposure to credit risk; and (b) **a description of collateral held as security and other credit enhancements, and their financial effect** (e.g. quantification of the extent to which collateral and other credit enhancements mitigate credit risk) in respect of the amount that best represents the maximum exposure to credit risk (whether disclosed in accordance with (a) or represented by the carrying amount of a financial instrument)?

If an entity has obtained financial or non-financial assets during the period by taking possession of collateral it holds as security or calling on other credit enhancements (e.g. guarantees), and such assets meet the recognition criteria in other Ind AS, whether the entity has disclosed the following for such assets held at the reporting date: (a) **The nature and carrying amount of the assets**; and (b) When the assets are not readily convertible into cash, **its policies for disposing of such assets or for using them in its operations**?

Whether the entity has given disclosure of the following with reference to the liquidity risk of financial instruments: (a) **a maturity analysis for non-derivative financial liabilities** (including issued financial guarantee contracts) that shows the remaining contractual maturities; (b) **a maturity analysis for derivative financial liabilities** (The maturity analysis shall include the remaining contractual maturities for those derivative financial liabilities for which contractual maturities are essential for an understanding of the timing of the cash flows); and (c) **a description of how it manages the liquidity risk inherent in (a) and (b) above**?

In case the entity believes that the sensitivity analyses disclosed in accordance with paragraphs 107.40 or 107.41 are unrepresentative of a risk inherent in a financial instrument, whether the entity has disclosed: (i) **that fact**; and (ii) **the reason it believes that the sensitivity analyses are unrepresentative**?

Whether the entity has disclosed the information to enable the users: (a) **to understand the relationship between transferred financial assets that are not derecognised in their entirety and the associated liabilities**; and (b) **to evaluate the nature of, and risks associated with, the entity’s continuing involvement in derecognised financial assets**?

In case an entity derecognises transferred financial assets in their entirety (see paragraph 109.3.2.6(a) and 109.3.2.6(c)(i)) but has continuing involvement in them, whether the entity has provided the disclosure of the following, as a minimum, for each type of continuing involvement at each reporting date: (a) **the carrying amount of the assets and liabilities that are recognised in the entity’s balance sheet and represent the entity’s continuing involvement in the derecognised financial assets**, and the line items in which the carrying amount of those assets and liabilities are recognised; (b) **the fair value of the assets and liabilities that represent the entity’s continuing involvement in the derecognised financial assets**; (c) **the amount that best represents the entity’s maximum exposure to loss from its continuing involvement in the derecognised financial assets**, and information showing how the maximum exposure to loss is determined; (d) **the undiscounted cash outflow that would or may be required to repurchase derecognised financial assets** (e.g. the strike price in an option agreement) or other amounts payable to the transferee in respect of the transferred assets (If the cash outflow is variable then the amount disclosed should be based on the conditions that exist at each reporting date); (e) **a maturity analysis of the undiscounted cash outflows that would or may be required to repurchase the derecognised financial assets** or other amounts payable to the transferee in respect of the transferred assets, showing the remaining contractual maturities of the entity’s continuing involvement; and (f) **qualitative information that explains and supports the quantitative disclosures required in (a)–(e)**? (Note: The entity may aggregate the information required as above in respect of a particular asset if the entity has more than one type of continuing involvement in that derecognised financial asset, and report it under one type of continuing involvement).

Has the entity grouped financial instruments into appropriate classes for disclosure, considering their characteristics, and provided sufficient information for reconciliation to balance sheet line items?
Has the entity disclosed information enabling users of its financial statements to evaluate the significance of financial instruments for its financial position and performance?

For financial assets designated at fair value through profit or loss, has the entity disclosed the maximum exposure to credit risk, the mitigation by related credit derivatives, and the change in fair value attributable to changes in credit risk (both for the period and cumulatively)?

Has the entity provided quantitative tabular disclosures at period end for financial assets and liabilities within netting arrangements, including gross amounts, set-off amounts, net amounts, and amounts subject to master netting arrangements (including collateral)?
Has the entity disclosed the carrying amount of financial assets pledged as collateral for liabilities or contingent liabilities (including reclassified amounts) and their terms and conditions?
For an instrument containing both a liability and an equity component with multiple interdependent embedded derivatives, has the entity disclosed the existence of these features?

Has the entity disclosed material accounting policy information for financial instruments, including details for FVTPL designations (nature, criteria, satisfaction of conditions), regular way purchase/sale accounting, determination of net gains/losses, and significant judgments?

For risk exposures applying hedge accounting, has the entity disclosed its risk management strategy, how hedging affects future cash flows (amount, timing, uncertainty), and the effect of hedge accounting on its financial statements?

Has the entity explained its risk management strategy for each hedged risk category, enabling users to evaluate how each risk arises, how it's managed (entire item or risk components), and the extent of risk exposure managed?

To meet the risk management strategy disclosure requirement, has the entity described the hedging instruments used, how the economic relationship was determined for effectiveness, the hedge ratio established, and sources of hedge ineffectiveness?

When a specific risk component is designated as a hedged item, has the entity provided qualitative or quantitative information on how it was determined and its relationship to the item in its entirety?

If exempt from 107.23A/B due to dynamic hedging relationships, has the entity disclosed its ultimate risk management strategy, how it applies hedge accounting, and the frequency of discontinuing and restarting hedging relationships?
Has the entity disclosed by risk category a description of the expected sources of hedge ineffectiveness during the hedging relationship's term?
If other sources of hedge ineffectiveness emerge, has the entity disclosed those sources by risk category and explained the resulting ineffectiveness?
For cash flow hedges, has the entity described any forecast transaction for which hedge accounting was used in a previous period but is no longer expected to occur?

Has the entity disclosed information related to interest rate benchmark reform to understand its effect on financial instruments and risk management strategy, including the nature/extent of risks and transition progress/management?

To meet the objectives of paragraph 107.24I, has the entity disclosed how it manages the transition to alternative benchmark rates, quantitative information on financial instruments yet to transition (disaggregated), and descriptions of changes in risk management strategy due to these risks?

Has the entity disclosed information enabling users to evaluate the nature and extent of risks (market, liquidity, credit) arising from financial instruments at the reporting period end, combining qualitative and quantitative disclosures?

Are disclosures required by paragraphs 107.35F-107.35N provided for financial instruments applying Ind AS 109 impairment requirements, with specified considerations for trade/contract/lease receivables?

Has the entity provided a tabular reconciliation of the loss allowance by class of financial instrument from opening to closing balance, separately showing changes for 12-month ECL, lifetime ECL (for various stages), and purchased/originated credit-impaired assets?

Has the entity explained how significant changes in the gross carrying amount of financial instruments contributed to changes in the loss allowance for each class, with separate qualitative and quantitative information?

By class of financial instrument, has the entity disclosed information about collateral and other credit enhancements, including maximum credit risk exposure without collateral, a narrative description of collateral (nature, quality, significant changes), and quantitative information for credit-impaired assets?
Has the entity disclosed the contractual amount outstanding on financial assets that were written off during the period and are still subject to enforcement activity?

Has the entity disclosed the gross carrying amount of financial assets and credit risk exposure on loan commitments and financial guarantee contracts, by credit risk rating grades, separately for 12-month ECL, lifetime ECL (including different stages), and purchased/originated credit-impaired financial instruments?

For financial instruments within Ind AS 107 scope but not applying Ind AS 109 impairment requirements, has the entity disclosed its maximum exposure to credit risk without collateral and a description/financial effect of collateral/credit enhancements?
DISCLOSURE_FINANCIAL_INSTRUMENTS.reference: 107.36, Ind AS 107, Ind AS 109, Ind AS 32

DISCLOSURE_FINANCIAL_INSTRUMENTS.question: Has the entity disclosed liquidity risk information for financial instruments, including a maturity analysis for non-derivative and derivative financial liabilities showing remaining contractual maturities, and a description of how liquidity risk is managed?
If the entity believes sensitivity analyses disclosed under 107.40 or 107.41 are unrepresentative of a financial instrument's inherent risk, has it disclosed this fact and the reason?

If the entity is required by Ind AS 110 to apply the exception to consolidation and has accounted for its investment in a subsidiary at fair value through profit or loss, has this fact been disclosed [112.19A]?

Whether the disclosure requirement in paragraph 7.44A also applies to changes in financial assets if cash flows from those financial assets were, or future cash flows will be, included in cash flows from financing activities?
Does the entity disclose how each service concession arrangement is classified (for example, as a financial asset or intangible asset)?
Does the entity disclose the revenue and profit or loss recognised in the reporting period on exchanging construction services for a financial asset or an intangible asset under each arrangement?

MEASUREMENT_GENERAL.question: In a distribution of non-cash assets to owners, does the entity disclose the change in the carrying amount of the dividend payable recognised during the period because of changes in the fair value of the assets to be distributed?
For fair-value measurements required by IFRIC 17, does the entity provide the disclosures required by IFRS 13?
Does the entity disclose the fair value of the asset to be distributed as of the end of the reporting period, if it differs from its carrying amount?
Does the entity disclose the level of the fair value hierarchy (Level 1, Level 2 or Level 3) within which the fair value measurements are categorised in their entirety?
For fair value measurements categorised within Level 2 and Level 3, does the entity describe the valuation technique(s) and the inputs used?
For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, does the entity disclose quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, does the entity describe the valuation processes used (for example, how it sets policies and procedures and analyses changes in fair value measurements)?
For each class of property, plant and equipment, does the entity disclose the measurement bases used for determining the gross carrying amount?
If items of property, plant and equipment are stated at revalued amounts under the revaluation model, does the entity disclose the effective date of the revaluation?
If items of property, plant and equipment are stated at revalued amounts under the revaluation model, does the entity disclose whether an independent valuer was involved?
If items of property, plant and equipment are stated at revalued amounts under the revaluation model, does the entity disclose the fair value measurement disclosures required by IFRS 13?

If items of property, plant and equipment are stated at revalued amounts under the revaluation model, does the entity disclose, for each revalued class of assets, the carrying amount that would have been recognised had the assets been carried under the cost model?

If items of property, plant and equipment are stated at revalued amounts under the revaluation model, does the entity disclose the revaluation surplus, indicating the change for the period and any restrictions on its distribution to shareholders?
If the cost model is used, does the entity disclose the fair value of property, plant and equipment if this is materially different from the carrying amount?

Does each reconciliation show remeasurements of the net defined benefit liability (asset), including the return on plan assets (excluding amounts included elsewhere) and actuarial gains and losses from changes in financial assumptions?

Does the entity disaggregate the fair value of plan assets into classes that distinguish their nature and risks, subdividing each class into assets with quoted market prices in active markets and those without (e.g., investment funds, asset-backed securities, structured debt)?
Does the entity disclose the carrying amount of inventories carried at fair value less costs to sell?
Do the financial statements of the retirement benefit plan contain a statement of net assets available for benefits disclosing the basis of valuation of assets?

Do the financial statements of the retirement benefit plan contain a statement of net assets available for benefits disclosing assets at the end of the period, the basis of valuation of assets, details of any single investment exceeding either 5% of the net assets available for benefits or 5% of any class or type of security, and details of any investment in the employer?
If the method used to account for investments in subsidiaries, associates and joint ventures is fair value, does the entity disclose the IFRS 13 fair-value measurement disclosures?
If the method used to account for those investments is fair value, does the parent or investor disclose the IFRS 13 fair-value measurement disclosures?
If the method used to account for the investments listed under (c) is fair value, does the parent or investor disclose the IFRS 13 fair-value measurement disclosures?
For fair value measurements categorised within Level 2 or 3, does the entity describe the valuation technique(s) used and any changes in technique with reasons?
For fair value measurements within Level 2 or 3, does the entity disclose each key assumption and the discount rate(s) used?
Does the entity disclose the fair value hierarchy level within which the fair value measurement is categorised?
Does the entity disclose whether it applies the fair value model or the cost model?
Does the entity disclose the fair value measurement disclosures required by IFRS 13?
If the entity applies the fair value model, does it reconcile additions (disclosing separately those from acquisitions and those from subsequent expenditure)?
Does the reconciliation include net gains or losses from fair value adjustments?

In exceptional cases where fair value cannot be reliably measured and cost model is used, does the entity present a separate reconciliation under IAS 40.76 of the carrying amount at the beginning and end of the period for that property?
Does the entity explain why fair value cannot be measured reliably?

In exceptional cases where fair value cannot be measured reliably, does the entity disclose a description of the property, an explanation of why fair value cannot be reliably measured, and if possible, the range of estimates within which fair value is highly likely to lie?
Does the entity disclose non-financial measures or estimates of the physical quantities of the output of agricultural produce during the period?
Does the entity explain why fair value cannot be measured reliably?
If the entity uses fair value as deemed cost in its opening IFRS statement of financial position, does it disclose the aggregate adjustment to the carrying amounts reported under previous GAAP?

For any historical summaries or comparative information under previous GAAP that do not comply with IFRS recognition and measurement, does the entity label that information prominently as not being prepared under IFRS accounting standards?
For each joint venture that is material to the reporting entity, does the entity disclose whether the investment in the joint venture is measured using the equity method or at fair value?
If the entity measures its interest in the joint venture at fair value, does it disclose the basis on which the summarised financial information has been prepared?
For each material joint venture, does the entity disclose whether the investment is measured using the equity method or at fair value?
If equity-accounted, are the joint venture’s IFRS statement amounts adjusted for fair value adjustments at acquisition and accounting policy differences?
If the entity measures its interest in a joint venture at fair value, does it disclose the basis on which the summarised financial information has been prepared?
For each material associate, does the entity disclose whether the investment is measured using the equity method or at fair value?
If equity-accounted, are the associate’s IFRS statement amounts adjusted for fair value adjustments at acquisition and accounting policy differences?

If the entity presents information on the basis of the associate’s financial statements because it measures the investment at fair value or preparation of IFRS statements is impracticable, does it disclose the basis on which the summarised information has been prepared?

For assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring or non-recurring basis after initial recognition, does the entity disclose the valuation techniques and inputs used to develop those measurements?

For recurring fair value measurements using significant unobservable inputs (Level 3), does the entity disclose the effect of those measurements on profit or loss or other comprehensive income for the period?
Does the entity classify assets and liabilities under the scope of IFRS 13 based on the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement is categorised?

For a liability measured at fair value and issued with an inseparable third-party credit enhancement, does the entity disclose the existence of that credit enhancement and whether it is reflected in the fair value measurement?

For assets and liabilities not measured at fair value in the statement of financial position but for which fair value is disclosed, does the entity disclose the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement(s) are categorised in their entirety?

For fair value measurements categorised within Levels 2 and 3 of the hierarchy, does the entity disclose a description of the valuation technique(s) and inputs used, and if there has been a change in valuation technique, the change and the reason(s) for making it?
For each class of assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis, does the entity disclose the fair value measurement at the end of the reporting period?

For each class of assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis, does the entity disclose the level of the fair value hierarchy (Level 1, 2 or 3) within which the measurements are categorised in their entirety?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 2 and 3, does the entity disclose a description of the valuation technique(s) and inputs used, any change in technique and the reasons, and for Level 3, quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, does the entity provide a reconciliation from opening to closing balances, separately disclosing changes attributable to: total gains or losses recognised in profit or loss and the line item(s) in which they are recognised; total gains or losses recognised in other comprehensive income and the line item(s) in which they are recognised; purchases, sales, issues and other settlements; and transfers into or out of Level 3 and the reasons for those transfers?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, does the entity disclose a description of the valuation processes used, including how it decides its valuation policies and procedures and analyses changes period to period?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3, does the entity disclose a narrative description of the sensitivity if a change in an unobservable input might result in a significantly higher or lower fair value measurement, and if there are interrelationships between significant unobservable inputs and other inputs, a narrative description of those interrelationships and how they might magnify or mitigate the effect of changes?
For each class of assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a non-recurring basis, does the entity disclose the fair value measurement at the end of the reporting period?
For assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a non-recurring basis, does the entity disclose the reasons for the fair value measurement?
For assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a non-recurring basis, does the entity disclose the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurements are categorised?

For fair value measurements categorised within Level 2 and 3 on a non-recurring basis, does the entity disclose a description of the valuation technique(s) and inputs used, any change in technique and the reasons, and for Level 3, quantitative information about the significant unobservable inputs used?
For fair value measurements categorised within Level 3 on a non-recurring basis, does the entity disclose a description of the valuation processes used?

For all periods in which disclosures are made applying IFRS 17.114(a) or 114(b), to enable users of financial statements to understand the nature and significance of the methods used and judgements applied in determining the transition amounts, does the entity explain how it determined the measurement of insurance contracts at the transition date

For each type of risk arising from contracts within the scope of IFRS 17, does the entity disclose: a. The exposures to risks and how they arise b. The entity’s objectives, policies and processes for managing the risks and the methods used to measure the risks c. Any changes in (a) or (b) from the previous period
If an entity applies IFRS 17.20 in determining the groups of insurance contracts to which it applies the recognition and measurement requirements of IFRS 17, does it disclose that fact

Does the entity classify income and expenses from the initial and subsequent measurement of liabilities arising from transactions that involve only the raising of finance in the financing category, except as set out in IFRS 18.63–66?
Are additional line items and subtotals comprised of amounts recognized and measured in accordance with IFRS?
Does the entity disclose the aspect of financial performance that, in management's view, is communicated by a management-defined performance measure?
Does the entity disclose how the management-defined performance measure compares with the measures defined by IFRS accounting standards?
Does the entity label and describe each management-defined performance measure in a way that faithfully represents its characteristics in accordance with IFRS 18.43?

If a measure is calculated other than by using the accounting policies used for items in the statement(s) of financial performance, does the entity disclose that fact and the calculations used for the measure?

Does the entity label the measure in a way that represents the characteristics of the subtotal (e.g., using the label 'operating profit before non-recurring expenses' only for a subtotal excluding identified non-recurring expenses)?
Does the entity disclose how each management-defined performance measure is calculated?
If the entity changes, adds, or ceases a management-defined performance measure, does it disclose an explanation enabling users to understand the change and its effects?
Does the entity disclose the reasons for the change, addition, or cessation of a management-defined performance measure?
Has the entity disclosed the weighted average fair value of share options granted during the period at the measurement date?
Has the entity disclosed the option pricing model used to measure the fair value of share options granted during the period?
Has the entity disclosed the number of other equity instruments granted during the period at the measurement date?
Has the entity disclosed the weighted average fair value of other equity instruments granted during the period at the measurement date?
If fair value of other equity instruments was not measured based on an observable market price, has the entity disclosed how it was determined?
Has the entity disclosed whether and how expected dividends were incorporated into the measurement of fair value of other equity instruments granted during the period?
Has the entity disclosed whether and how any other features of other equity instruments granted during the period were incorporated into the measurement of fair value?
Has the entity disclosed how the incremental fair value granted as a result of modifications was measured, consistent with the requirements for share options and other equity instruments?
Has the entity disclosed the acquisition-date fair value of equity interests issued or issuable, and how those were measured?
For non-controlling interests held at acquisition, has the entity disclosed the amount recognised and the measurement basis?
For any non-controlling interest measured at fair value, has the entity disclosed the valuation techniques and significant inputs used?
Has the entity disclosed the nature and amount of any measurement-period adjustments recognised during the period?
Has the entity reconciled the gross carrying amount of goodwill at the beginning of the period?
Has the entity disclosed the process used to determine the assumptions that have the greatest effect on the measurement of recognised amounts?
Has the entity disclosed how the assumptions used in the measurement relate to observable market prices or rates?
For fair-value measurements (including fair value less costs to sell) required by IFRS 5, does the entity provide the disclosures required by IFRS 13?
Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial liabilities measured at amortised cost?

Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of investments in equity instruments designated as measured at fair value through other comprehensive income upon initial recognition in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.5?
Does the entity disclose the loss allowance for a debt instrument measured at fair value through other comprehensive income in the notes to the financial statements
Does the entity disclose the basis of inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used to measure the 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses?
Does the entity disclose, either in the statement of financial position or in the notes, the carrying amounts of financial liabilities measured at amortised cost

When the counterparty to the associated liabilities has recourse only to the transferred assets, does the entity provide a schedule of the fair value of transferred assets, fair value of associated liabilities, and the net position?

If the gain or loss on derecognition arose because component fair values differed from the asset’s fair value, does the entity disclose whether those fair value measurements included significant unobservable inputs?
Does the entity disclose the loss allowance for debt instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income in the notes?
Does the entity disclose net gains or losses on financial liabilities measured at amortised cost?
For those same instruments, does the entity disclose the valuation technique(s) and inputs used to measure the fair value at initial recognition?
Does the entity disclose how it monitors whether the loss allowance on those modified assets is subsequently remeasured back to lifetime expected credit losses?

Does the entity disclose the basis of inputs, assumptions and estimation techniques used to measure 12-month and lifetime expected credit losses and to determine significant increases in credit risk and credit-impaired status?

If an insurer applies IFRS 9 without restating comparatives for classification and measurement, has it completed Questions 287–339 of the February 2018 Disclosure Checklist for the comparative periods?
At that date, does the entity disclose the new measurement category and carrying amount after applying the IFRS 17 amendments?

Whether the entity has disclosed the carrying amount of the dividend payable at the beginning and end of the period, and the increase or decrease in the carrying amount recognised in the period as a result of a change in the fair value of the assets to be distributed, if applicable?

If a dividend to distribute a non-cash asset is declared after the reporting period but before financial statements are approved for issue, whether the nature of the asset, its carrying amount at the end of the reporting period, its fair value (if different from carrying amount), and information about the measurement method (required by Ind AS 113 paragraphs) have been disclosed?
In case retrospective remeasurement of service arrangement assets is not practicable, has the entity **disclosed such fact**?
In case fair value of goods or services received during the period is measured directly, whether the entity has provided disclosure of how that fair value was determined [8].

In case the presumption in paragraph 102.13 that the fair value of the goods or services received cannot be estimated reliably is rebutted, whether the entity has given disclosure of that fact, and an explanation of why the presumption was rebutted [9].

In case investments in equity instruments measured at fair value through other comprehensive income is derecognised during the reporting period, whether the disclosure of the following has been made: (a) **the reasons for disposing of the investments**; (b) **the fair value of the investments at the date of derecognition**; (c) **the cumulative gain or loss on disposal**?

To meet the objectives in paragraph 107.21A, an entity shall (except as otherwise specified below) determine how much detail to disclose, how much emphasis to place on different aspects of the disclosure requirements, the appropriate level of aggregation or disaggregation, and whether users of financial statements need additional explanations to evaluate the quantitative information disclosed? Whether the entity has ensured the **same level of aggregation / disaggregation in the disclosure as it has for related information between this standard and Ind AS 113, Fair Value Measurement**?

For contracts with discretionary participation features where fair value cannot be reliably measured, has the entity disclosed this fact, a description of the instruments, market information, disposal intentions, and derecognition details if applicable?

Has the entity explained its credit risk management practices and their relation to ECL recognition/measurement, including how credit risk increase is determined, definitions of default, collective measurement grouping, credit-impaired assets determination, write-off policy, and application of modification requirements?

Has the entity disclosed the inputs, assumptions, and estimation techniques used for ECL measurement (including 12-month and lifetime ECL, significant credit risk increase, and credit-impaired assets), incorporation of forward-looking information, and changes in techniques/assumptions?

Has the entity disclosed any gain or loss (calculated per 110.25) from losing control of a subsidiary, including the portion attributable to measuring retained investment at fair value, and the relevant profit or loss line item(s) [112.19]?

Has the entity presented summarised financial information (per 112.B12 and 112.B13) based on the joint venture's or associate's financial statements only if its interest is measured at fair value (per Ind AS 28) and the joint venture/associate does not prepare Ind AS financial statements and doing so would be impracticable/costly [112.B15]?

Whether the entity has given disclosure of the following: a) for assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value on a recurring or non-recurring basis in the balance sheet after initial recognition, the valuation techniques and inputs used to develop those measurements, and b) for recurring fair value measurements using significant unobservable inputs (Level 3), the effect of the measurements on profit or loss or other comprehensive income for the period.

Whether the entity has determined the appropriate classes of assets and liabilities based on the following: a) the nature, characteristics and risks of the asset or liability, and b) the level of the fair value hierarchy within which the fair value measurement is categorised.

In case entity has issued a liability with inseparable third-party credit enhancement and measured the same at fair value, whether the disclosure of the existence of that credit enhancement has been made and whether it is reflected in the fair value measurement of the liability.
Whether the entity disclosed the fair value by using one of the following techniques: i) Present value techniques, ii) Option pricing models, or iii) Multi-period excess earnings method.

If PPE items are stated at revalued amounts, has the entity disclosed, in addition to Ind AS 113 requirements, the effective date of revaluation, involvement of an independent valuer, the carrying amount under the cost model for each revalued class, and the revaluation surplus (change for the period and distribution restrictions)?
When the cost model is used, has the entity voluntarily disclosed the fair value of PPE when this is materially different from the carrying amount?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of **the total carrying amount of inventories** and the carrying amount in **classifications appropriate to the entity**?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of the **carrying amount of inventories carried at fair value less costs to sell**?
Whether the entity has made disclosure of the **carrying amount of inventories pledged as security for liabilities**?

PRESENTATION_FINANCIAL_POSITION.question: Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the period as part of a complete set of financial statements?

When departing from an IFRS requirement due to misleading compliance, does the entity disclose that management concluded that the financial statements present fairly the entity's financial position, financial performance and cash flows?

Does the entity present, as a minimum, two statements of financial position, two statements of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, two separate statements of profit or loss (if presented), two statements of cash flows and two statements of changes in equity, and related notes?
Does the entity include provisions as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity include financial liabilities (excluding amounts shown under trade and other payables and provisions) as a line item in its statement of financial position?
If the entity applies IAS 1, does it present each material class of similar items separately in the statement of cash flows?
Does the entity classify dividends paid as cash flows from financing activities?
Does the entity classify interest and dividends received as cash flows from investing activities?

Does such an entity classify the total of each of these cash flows in a single category in the statement of cash flows (that is, either as operating, investing or financing activities), associated with the categories of the statement of profit or loss?

Does the entity report cash flows from operating activities using the indirect method, in which the entity adjusts profit or loss (or operating profit or loss, if the entity early adopts IFRS 18) for cash flows from operating activities for which the associated income or expenses are not classified in the operating category of the statement of profit or loss?
Does the entity reconcile the amounts of cash and cash equivalents in the statement of cash flows with the equivalent items in the statement of financial position?
Have the aggregate cash flows arising from obtaining control of subsidiaries or other businesses been presented separately and classified as investing activities in the statement of cash flows?
Have the aggregate cash flows arising from losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses been presented separately and classified as investing activities in the statement of cash flows?
Are investing and financing transactions that do not require the use of cash or cash equivalents excluded from the statement of cash flows?
Does the entity disclose that management concluded the financial statements present fairly the entity’s position, performance and cash flows when departing from a requirement?
If the entity presented a statement of cash flows under its previous GAAP, does it explain the material adjustments to that statement of cash flows?
In its first IFRS financial statements, does the entity present two statements of cash flows?
In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify cash payments for the principal portion of lease liabilities within financing activities?
In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify cash payments for the interest portion of lease liabilities applying IAS 7 requirements for interest paid?

In the statement of cash flows, does the entity classify short-term lease payments, low-value lease payments, and variable lease payments not included in lease liabilities within operating activities?

If an entity presents separately the amounts recovered from the reinsurer and an allocation of the premiums paid, does it: a. Treat reinsurance cash flows that are contingent on claims on the underlying contracts as part of the claims that are expected to be reimbursed under the reinsurance contract held b. Treat amounts from the reinsurer that it expects to receive that are not contingent on claims of the underlying contracts (for example, some types of ceding commissions) as a reduction in the premiums to be paid to the reinsurer c. Treat amounts recognised relating to the recovery of losses applying IFRS 17.66(c)(i)‒(ii) and 66A‒66B as amounts recovered from the reinsurer d. Avoid presenting the allocation of premiums paid as a reduction in revenue

For insurance contracts other than those to which the premium allocation approach described in IFRS 17.53–59 or 69–70A has been applied, does the entity disclose the effect on the statement of financial position separately for insurance contracts issued and reinsurance contracts held that are initially recognised in the period, showing their effect at initial recognition on: a. The estimates of the present value of future cash outflows, showing separately the amount of the insurance acquisition cash flows b. The estimates of the present value of future cash inflows c. The risk adjustment for non-financial risk d. The contractual service margin
Does the entity present a statement of cash flows for the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose that management concluded the financial statements present fairly the entity's financial position, performance and cash flows?

Does the entity classify and aggregate assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses or cash flows into items based on shared characteristics, unless doing so would override specific aggregation or disaggregation requirements in IFRS?
Does the entity present provisions as a separate line item?
Does the entity present financial liabilities (excluding trade payables and provisions) as a separate line item?

For each date that a statement of financial position is presented, does the entity reconcile the amounts in that statement to the amounts for reportable segments (restating prior periods as required)?

Has the entity presented a complete set of Financial Statements, including a Balance Sheet, a statement of profit and loss, a Statement of Changes in Equity, a statement of cash flows, notes comprising material accounting policy and explanatory information, comparative information for the preceding period (as per paragraphs 38 and 38A), and a Balance Sheet at the beginning of the preceding period if applying an accounting policy retrospectively, making a retrospective restatement, or reclassifying items (as per paragraphs 40A–40D)?
Has the entity presented a minimum of two Balance Sheets, two statements of profit and loss, two statements of cash flows, two Statements of Changes in Equity, and related notes?

Has the entity presented notes in a systematic manner, and has it cross-referenced each item in the Balance Sheet, statement of profit and loss, and in the statements of changes in equity and of cash flows to any related information in the notes?

Does the entity's first Ind AS financial statements include at least **three Balance Sheets, two Statements of profit and loss, two Statements of cash flows and two Statements of changes in equity and related notes**, including comparative information for all statements presented?
When the entity presents a Statement of cash flows under its previous GAAP, has it also **explained the material adjustments to the Statement of cash flows**?

Whether the entity has disclosed the following information in the notes in the period in which a non-current asset (or disposal group) has been either classified as held for sale or sold: (a) a description of the non-current asset (or disposal group); (b) a description of the facts and circumstances of the sale, or leading to the expected disposal, and the expected manner and timing of that disposal; (c) the gain or loss recognised in accordance with paragraphs 105.20–105.22 and, if not separately presented in the statement of profit and loss, the caption in the statement of profit and loss that includes that gain or loss; and (d) if applicable, the reportable segment in which the non-current asset (or disposal group) is presented in accordance with Ind AS 108, Operating Segments.

Whether for hedging relationships to which an entity applies the exceptions set out in paragraphs 109.6.8.4-109.6.8.12, the following disclosures have been made: (a) **the significant interest rate benchmarks to which the entity‘s hedging relationships are exposed**; (b) **the extent of the risk exposure the entity manages that is directly affected by the interest rate benchmark reform**; (c) **how the entity is managing the process to transition to alternative benchmark rates**; (d) **a description of significant assumptions or judgements the entity made in applying these paragraphs** (for example, assumptions or judgements about when the uncertainty arising from interest rate benchmark reform is no longer present with respect to the timing and the amount of the interest rate benchmark-based cash flows); and (e) **the nominal amount of the hedging instruments in those hedging relationships**?

Whether the entity has made disclosure about termination benefits for key management personnel in accordance with Ind AS 24, Related Party Disclosures, and disclosure of termination benefits expense in accordance with Ind AS 1, Presentation of Financial Statements?
search_terms: ind as 1, presentation of financial statements

PRESENTATION_FINANCIAL_POSITION.question: Does the interim financial report include, at a minimum, a condensed Balance Sheet, a condensed statement of profit and loss, a condensed Statement of Changes in Equity, a condensed statement of cash flows, and selected explanatory notes?
Whether the statement of cash flows has reported cash flows during the period classified by operating, investing, and financing activities?

PRESENTATION_FOREIGN_CURRENCY.question: Does the entity prominently display the presentation currency, as defined in IAS 21.8, at least once in the financial statements?
If the presentation currency is different from the functional currency, does the entity disclose that fact?
Does the entity disclose the reason for using a different presentation currency?

If the entity presents its financial statements in a currency different from its functional currency, does it describe them as complying with IFRS only if they comply with all applicable requirements, including the translation method in IAS 21.39 and IAS 21.42?

Does the entity disclose that the financial statements and the corresponding figures for previous periods have been restated for changes in the general purchasing power of the functional currency and are stated in terms of the measuring unit current at the end of the reporting period?

Does the entity disclose net exchange differences arising on the translation of the financial statements into the presentation currency, and on the translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the reporting entity?
Does the reconciliation include the net exchange differences arising on translation into a different presentation currency and on translation of a foreign operation?

Does the entity separately present the effect of exchange rate changes on cash and cash equivalents held or due in a foreign currency in the statement of cash flows in order to reconcile cash and cash equivalents at the beginning and the end of the period?
Does the entity disclose prominently the presentation currency, as defined in IAS 21 The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates?
search_terms: ias 21 the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates

PRESENTATION_FOREIGN_CURRENCY.question: Has the entity clearly identified each financial statement and the notes, and prominently displayed (repeating as necessary) the name of the reporting entity/other means of identification (and any changes), whether the Financial Statements are of an individual or group entity, the date of the reporting period end/period covered, the presentation currency (as defined in Ind AS 21), and the level of rounding used?

If the presentation currency is different from the functional currency, has the entity **stated that fact together with disclosure of the functional currency and the reason for using a different presentation currency**?

If financial statements or other financial information are presented in a currency different from the functional currency or presentation currency, and the requirements of paragraph 21.55 are not met, has the information been **clearly identified as supplementary information** to distinguish it from Ind AS compliant information?

If financial statements or other financial information are presented in a currency different from the functional currency or presentation currency, and the requirements of paragraph 21.55 are not met, has the entity **disclosed the currency in which the supplementary information is displayed**?

If financial statements or other financial information are presented in a currency different from the functional currency or presentation currency, and the requirements of paragraph 21.55 are not met, has the entity **disclosed its functional currency and the method of translation used to determine the supplementary information**?

Whether the entity has made disclosure of the fact that the financial statements and the corresponding figures for previous periods have been restated for the changes in the general purchasing power of the functional currency and, as a result, are stated in terms of the measuring unit current at the end of the reporting period?

PRESENTATION_TAX.question: If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current assets in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax assets as non-current assets?
If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current liabilities in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax liabilities as non-current liabilities?
Does the entity include liabilities and assets for current tax as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity include deferred tax liabilities and deferred tax assets as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity present tax expense as a line item in the profit or loss section or the statement of profit or loss?

Does the entity include the amount of income taxes associated with transaction costs accounted for as a deduction from equity in the aggregate amount of current and deferred tax credited or charged directly to equity?
Does the entity disclose separately the current tax expense (income)?
Do the parent’s separate financial statements, if any, disclose the potential income tax consequences relating to the parent’s retained earnings?
Does the entity separately disclose its current tax expense (income) related to Pillar Two income taxes?

Does the entity include the amount of income taxes associated with transaction costs accounted for as a deduction from equity in the aggregate amount of current and deferred tax credited or charged directly to equity?

When an entity recognises a deferred tax asset or liability as a result of recognising regulatory deferral account balances, does the entity present the resulting deferred tax asset (liability) and the related movement with the related regulatory deferral account balances and movements, instead of within the totals presented in accordance with IAS 12?
Instead of applying IAS 12, does the entity present the deferred tax asset (liability) with the line items presented for the regulatory deferral account debit balances and credit balances?
Instead of applying IAS 12, does the entity present the deferred tax asset (liability) as a separate line item alongside the related regulatory deferral account debit balances and credit balances?
Instead of applying IAS 12, does the entity present the movement in the deferred tax asset (liability) with the line items presented for the movements in regulatory deferral account balances?
Instead of applying IAS 12, does the entity present the movement in the deferred tax asset (liability) as a separate line item alongside the related movements in regulatory deferral account balances?

Does the entity classify in the operating category all income and expenses included in the statement of profit or loss that are not classified in the investing, financing, income taxes, or discontinued operations categories?
Does the entity classify in the income taxes category tax expense or tax income included in the statement of profit or loss under IAS 12, including related foreign exchange differences?
Does the entity present totals and subtotals for profit or loss before financing and income taxes, subject to IFRS 18.73?

Does the entity either present in the statement presenting comprehensive income or disclose in the notes the amount of income taxes relating to each item of other comprehensive income, including reclassification adjustments?
If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current assets in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax assets as non-current assets?
If the entity distinguishes between current and non-current liabilities in its financial statements, does it present deferred tax liabilities as non-current liabilities?
Does the entity present current tax liabilities and assets as a separate line item?
Does the entity present deferred tax liabilities and assets as a separate line item?

Does the entity disclose additions to non-current assets (other than financial instruments, deferred tax assets, post-employment benefit assets and insurance rights) for each reportable segment when included in the reviewed measure of segment assets?
Does the entity report non-current assets (other than financial instruments, deferred tax assets, post-employment benefit assets and insurance rights) located in its country of domicile?

When the entity presents current and non-current assets, and current and non-current liabilities, as separate classifications in its Balance Sheet, has it ensured that deferred tax assets (liabilities) are not classified as current assets (liabilities)?

Has the entity presented items of other comprehensive income either net of related tax effects, or before related tax effects with one amount shown for the aggregate amount of income tax relating to those items, and if the latter, has it allocated the tax between the items that might be reclassified subsequently to the profit or loss section and those that will not be reclassified subsequently to the profit or loss section?

Has the entity disclosed, for each reportable segment, the amounts of additions to non-current assets (excluding financial instruments, deferred tax assets, post-employment benefit assets and rights under insurance contracts) if included in the measure of segment assets reviewed by the chief operating decision maker, or otherwise regularly provided to them?

Has the entity provided geographical information, including non-current assets (excluding financial instruments, deferred tax assets, post-employment benefit assets and rights under insurance contracts) located in the entity’s country of domicile and in all foreign countries in total (separately if material for individual countries), unless impracticable?

(a) When rate regulation affect the amount and timing of an entity’s income tax expense (income), whether the entity has disclosed the impact of the rate regulation on the amounts of current and deferred tax recognised. (b) In addition, whether the entity has separately disclosed any regulatory deferral account balance that relates to taxation and the related movement in that balance.

Whether the entity has offset the current tax assets and current tax liabilities only in case where the following conditions have met: (a) the entity has a legally enforceable right to set off the recognised amounts; and (b) the entity intends either to settle on a net basis, or to realise the asset and settle the liability simultaneously?

Whether the entity has offset deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities only in case where following conditions have met: (a) the entity has a legally enforceable right to set off current tax assets against current tax liabilities; and (b) the deferred tax assets and the deferred tax liabilities relate to income taxes levied by the same taxation authority on either: (i) the same taxable entity; or (ii) different taxable entities which intend either to settle current tax liabilities and assets on a net basis, or to realize the assets and settle the liabilities simultaneously, in each future period in which significant amounts of deferred tax liabilities or assets are expected to be settled or recovered?

Whether the exchange differences on deferred foreign tax liabilities or assets are recognized in the statement of profit and loss, are classified as deferred tax expense (income), if that presentation is considered to be the most useful to financial statement users?

Whether the disclosures of following major components of tax expense (income) have been made separately: (a) current tax expense (income); (b) any adjustments recognised in the period for current tax of prior periods; (c) the amount of deferred tax expense (income) relating to the origination and reversal of temporary differences; (d) the amount of deferred tax expense (income) relating to changes in tax rates or the imposition of new taxes; (e) the amount of the benefit arising from a previously unrecognised tax loss, tax credit or temporary difference of a prior period that is used to reduce current tax expense; (f) the amount of the benefit from a previously unrecognised tax loss, tax credit or temporary difference of a prior period that is used to reduce deferred tax expense; (g) deferred tax expense arising from the write-down, or reversal of a previous write-down, of a deferred tax asset in accordance with paragraph 56 of this Standard; and (h) the amount of tax expense (income) relating to those changes in accounting policies and errors that are included in profit or loss in accordance with Ind AS 8, Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors, because they cannot be accounted for retrospectively?

Whether the entity has made separate disclosure of the following: (a) the aggregate current and deferred tax relating to items that are charged or credited directly to equity (see paragraph 12.62A); (b) the amount of income tax relating to each component of other comprehensive income (paragraph 12.62 and Ind AS 1, Presentation of Financial Statements); (c) an explanation of the relationship between tax expense (income) and accounting profit in either or both of the following forms: (i) a numerical reconciliation between tax expense (income) and the product of accounting profit multiplied by the applicable tax rate(s), disclosing also the basis on which the applicable tax rate(s) is (are) computed; or (ii) a numerical reconciliation between the average effective tax rate and the applicable tax rate, disclosing also the basis on which the applicable tax rate is computed; (d) an explanation of changes in the applicable tax rate(s) compared to the previous accounting period; (e) the amount (and expiry date, if any) of deductible temporary differences, unused tax losses, and unused tax credits for which no deferred tax asset is recognised in the balance sheet; (f) the aggregate amount of temporary differences associated with investments in subsidiaries, branches and associates and interests in joint arrangements, for which deferred tax liabilities have not been recognised (see paragraph 12.39); (g) in respect of each type of temporary difference, and in respect of each type of unused tax losses and unused tax credits: (i) the amount of the deferred tax assets and liabilities recognised in the balance sheet for each period presented; (ii) the amount of the deferred tax income or expense recognised in profit or loss, if this is not apparent from the changes in the amounts recognised in the balance sheet; (h) in respect of discontinued operations, the tax expense relating to: (i) the gain or loss on discontinuance; and (ii) the profit or loss from the ordinary activities of the discontinued operation for the period, together with the corresponding amounts for each prior period presented; (i) the amount of income tax consequences of dividends to shareholders of the entity that were proposed or declared before the financial statements were approved for issue, but are not recognised as a liability in the financial statements; (j) if a business combination in which the entity is the acquirer causes a change in the amount recognised for its pre-acquisition deferred tax asset (paragraph 12.67), the amount of that change; and (k) if the deferred tax benefits acquired in a business combination are not recognised at the acquisition date but are recognised after the acquisition date (paragraph 12.68), a description of the event or change in circumstances that caused the deferred tax benefits to be recognised?

Whether the entity has disclosed that it is reasonably possible to determine some portions of the total amount of potential income tax consequences of dividends, even if the total amount is not practicable to compute? If applicable, whether the entity also disclosed that there are additional potential income tax consequences not practicably determinable? In the parent’s separate financial statements, if any, whether the entity has disclosed the potential income tax consequences relates to the parent’s retained earnings?

PRESENTATION_PROPERTY_ASSETS.question: Does the entity include investment property as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity include intangible assets as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity include biological assets within the scope of IAS 41 as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity present right-of-use assets separately from other assets in the statement of financial position (or disclose in the notes)?
If the entity does not present right-of-use assets separately, does it include them within the same line item as that in which the corresponding underlying assets would be presented if owned?
If the entity does not present right-of-use assets separately, does it disclose which line items include those right-of-use assets?
Does the entity present investment property as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present intangible assets as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?
Does the entity present biological assets within the scope of IAS 41 as a separate line item?

Has the entity presented the following amounts for the period in the Balance Sheet: Property, Plant and Equipment (PPE); investment property; intangible assets; financial assets (excluding investments accounted for using the equity method, trade and other receivables, and cash and cash equivalents); investments accounted for using the equity method; biological assets within the scope of Ind AS 41 Agriculture; inventories; trade and other receivables; cash and cash equivalents; total of assets classified as held for sale and assets included in disposal groups classified as held for sale in accordance with Ind AS 105; trade and other payables; provisions; financial liabilities (excluding trade and other payables and provisions); liabilities and assets for current tax (as defined in Ind AS 12); deferred tax liabilities and deferred tax assets (as defined in Ind AS 12); liabilities included in disposal groups classified as held for sale in accordance with Ind AS 105; non-controlling interests (presented within equity); and issued capital and reserves attributable to owners of the parent?

Has a **reconciliation been provided of changes in carrying amount of biological assets between the beginning and the end of the current period**, including: a) the gain or loss arising from changes in fair value less costs to sell, b) increases due to purchases, c) decreases attributable to sales and biological assets classified as held for sale (or included in a disposal group that is classified as held for sale) in accordance with Ind AS 105, d) decreases due to harvest, e) increases resulting from business combinations, f) net exchange differences arising on the translation of financial statements into a different presentation currency, and on the translation of a foreign operation into the presentation currency of the reporting entity, and g) Other changes?

The fair value less costs to sell of a biological asset can change due to both physical changes and price changes in the market. Separate disclosure of physical and price changes is useful in appraising current period performance and future prospects, particularly when there is a production cycle of more than one year. In such cases, does the entity disclose, by group or otherwise, the **amount of change in fair value less costs to sell included in profit or loss due to physical changes and due to price changes**?

PRESENTATION_FINANCIAL_INSTRUMENTS.question: Does the entity include financial assets (excluding amounts shown under equity method investments, trade and other receivables, and cash and cash equivalents) as a line item in its statement of financial position?
Does the entity present gains and losses arising from the derecognition of financial assets measured at amortised cost as a line item in the profit or loss section or the statement of profit or loss?

Does the entity present any gain or loss arising from reclassifying a financial asset out of the amortised cost measurement category to fair value through profit or loss as a line item in the profit or loss section or the statement of profit or loss?

Does the entity present any cumulative gain or loss from reclassifying a financial asset out of the fair value through other comprehensive income measurement category to fair value through profit or loss as a line item in the profit or loss section or the statement of profit or loss?
If the entity designates a previously recognised financial asset under IFRS 1.D19A, does it disclose the classification and carrying amount in the previous financial statements?
If the entity designates a previously recognised financial liability under IFRS 1.D19, does it disclose the classification and carrying amount in the previous financial statements?

If the entity invests in financial assets that generate a return individually and largely independently of its other resources, does it classify related income and expenses on cash and cash equivalents in the operating category?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not designated as a hedge under IFRS 9 in the same category as the income and expenses affected by the risks managed?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not designated as a hedge under IFRS 9 in the operating category if required to avoid grossing up or undue cost or effort?

Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not used to manage identified risks in the financing category if it relates to raising finance, or in the operating category if the entity provides financing to customers as a main business activity?
Does the entity classify gains and losses on a derivative not used to manage identified risks in the operating category if the conditions in IFRS 18.B73(a) are not met?
Does the entity present financial assets (excluding amounts under g, j, k) as a separate line item in the statement of financial position?

If an entity does not apply the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity designated investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5, does it disclose: a. Which investments in equity instruments have been designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income b. The reasons for using this presentation alternative c. The fair value of each such investment at the end of the reporting period d. Dividends recognised during the period, showing separately: ► Those related to investments derecognised during the reporting period ► Those related to investments held at the end of the reporting period e. Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period and the reason for such transfers

If an entity applies the Amendments to IFRS 9 and IFRS 7 in Amendments to the Classification and Measurement of Financial Instruments, issued May 2024, and the entity designated investments in equity instruments to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income, as permitted by IFRS 9.5.7.5, does it disclose for each class of investment: a. Which investments in equity instruments have been designated to be measured at fair value through other comprehensive income b. The reasons for using this presentation alternative c. The fair value at the end of the reporting period d. Dividends recognised during the period, showing separately: ► Those related to investments derecognised during the reporting period ► Those related to investments held at the end of the reporting period e. Any transfers of the cumulative gain or loss within equity during the reporting period and the reason for such transfers f. The fair value gain or loss presented in other comprehensive income during the period, showing separately the fair value gain or loss related to investments derecognised during the reporting period and the fair value gain or loss related to investments held at the end of the reporting period

If the entity derecognised a financial asset measured at amortised cost, does it disclose an analysis of the gain or loss recognised in the statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income arising from the derecognition of those financial assets, showing separately gains and losses arising from derecognition?

Does the entity disclose, in a tabular format, the following amounts related to items designated as hedging instruments separately, by risk category, for each type of hedge (fair value hedge, cash flow hedge or hedge of a net investment in a foreign operation): a. The carrying amount of the hedging instruments (financial assets separately from financial liabilities) b. The line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedging instrument c. The change in fair value of the hedging instrument used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period d. The nominal amounts (including quantities such as tonnes or cubic metres) of the hedging instruments

Does the entity disclose, in a tabular format, the following amounts related to hedged items separately by risk category for fair value hedges: a. The carrying amount of the hedged item recognised in the statement of financial position (presenting assets separately from liabilities) b. The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustments on the hedged item included in the carrying amount of the hedged item recognised in the statement of financial position (presenting assets separately from liabilities) c. The line item in the statement of financial position that includes the hedged item d. The change in value of the hedged item used as the basis for recognising hedge ineffectiveness for the period e. The accumulated amount of fair value hedge adjustments remaining in the statement of financial position for any hedged items that have ceased to be adjusted for hedging gains and losses in accordance with IFRS 9.6.5.10

Does the entity disclose, in a tabular format, the following amounts separately by risk category for fair value hedges: a. Hedge ineffectiveness - i.e., the difference between the hedging gains or losses of the hedging instrument and the hedged item — recognised in profit or loss (or other comprehensive income for hedges of an equity instrument for which an entity has elected to present changes in fair value in other comprehensive income in accordance with IFRS 9.5.7.5) b. The line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness

Does the entity disclose, in a tabular format, the following amounts separately, by risk category, for cash flow hedges and hedges of a net investment in a foreign operation: a. Hedging gains or losses of the reporting period that were recognised in other comprehensive income b. Hedge ineffectiveness recognised in profit or loss c. The line item in the statement of comprehensive income that includes the recognised hedge ineffectiveness d.
